loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny was born and raised in Florida and has been running her CPR training business for two months. She was inspired to run a business dedicated to offering CPR training after witnessing recoveries and rescues that have taken place due to CPR and first-aid care. Jenny is continuously motivated by the tremendous rewards and positive outcomes survivors experience due to CPR. She is passionate about conducting trainings that will someday save one or more lives.

In running her business, Jenny’s biggest challenge has been finding time to network and increase advertising because she is often busy servicing her clients. Jenny is currently seeking a loan for working capital that will allow her to purchase necessary supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to have capital that will help her purchase supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Phia's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phia, born in 1973, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband and her daughter. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. Their income, after deducting costs, is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. Phia needs to get a health checkup, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for her health check.
	
She hopes that the loan amount will help her have money to check her health and have medical treatment on time, so she will be better and come back to work to get money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to check her health and get medical treatment on time.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has always been fascinated by mathematics and realized that his passion was a challenge for many people. In the past, he has helped people with their math work on many occasions. However, it wasn’t until 2010 that David decided to make his service more formal and began working from an incubator space. He currently contracts two tutors to help him offer his services. Although David’s business directly helps individuals increase their confidence and knowledge in mathematics, he sees his work as an opportunity to help his clients achieve more in life.

Since the time that David began offering tutoring services, his biggest challenge has been getting access to the finances necessary to improve his business. He is seeking a loan to build his credit and enhance advertising for his services. His vision is to increase the number of clients he works with within the New York City area.

loans.use: To build capital and enhance advertising for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 120 kilograms of tilapia and shrimps to sell.

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luan, born in 1966, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2009, and she lives with her husband, her daughter and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, and the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to buy nitrate to fertilize her cornfield but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family tend the cornfield well, and that the next corn crop will bring her family a bigger yield as compared to the last year.

loans.use: to buy nitrate to fertilize her cornfield.

loans.name: Shahram

texts.en:
Shahram immigrated to the U.S. from Iran nearly 10 years ago with his family. After years of working in the retail sector, Shahram started driving for Uber and Lyft in 2013 to earn additional income to support his family. 

Taxi drivers in San Diego are currently experiencing new freedoms and opportunities in their ability to operate and own their own taxis through the release of taxi cab medallions for purchase. Prior to this change, taxi cab drivers leased medallions and were forced to pay extremely high monthly lease rates for vehicles. 

Shahram saw the release of taxi cab medallions as an opportunity to enter into the taxi industry. He plans on using his $4,000 Kiva loan to purchase a medallion. He has also invested his personal savings into the purchase a new hybrid vehicle.

Shahram is proud to represent his family through the name of his business, Parsa Cab, named after his 4-year-old son.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi cab medallion

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives with his wife and kids and is originally from West Alexandria, Ohio. He started his plumbing and water systems business eight years ago with the mission of bettering his family’s future. Through his business, Christopher has had the opportunity to service commercial clients such as Walmart Inc. He also provides residential plumbing services.

Christopher is currently seeking a loan to purchase equipment needed for his business. His vision for the future is to start up an additional plumbing and water systems service vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, 64, is married with three adult-age children. His major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. He has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped him meet his family's financial needs, especially with the education of his children until they graduated and got jobs. '

He is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to his loyal customers. Someday, he will have a legacy to leave to his children. He also operates a rice production business that augments their family income. He already took loans previously to purchase bags of fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Norce

texts.en:
Norce finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she also earns an income as well. At the age of 43 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Norce wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Luong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luong, 30 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her two daughters and her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from gardening the mixed longan trees, so the annual income is just enough to cover the living expenses of her family and save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the longan tree garden but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the longan garden. Then, in the next harvest, it will bring her family so many big bunches of longan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Three quarters of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Zachary, 33, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya. He has now been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and has managed to earn a decent income. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business he engages in to make ends meet. He passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, he stated, “feeding my cows.” His hobby is milking his cow. He sells milk to his neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and he cannot meet it.

For this reason, he is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase his business enterprise.

Zachary is very visionary, and he intends that in the near future, he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling it, and he also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt and cream. An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

Like Zachary, thousands of smallholder farmers are hoping for your help; please make a loan.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Ginaline

texts.en: Ginaline is engaged in a direct selling business. She also raises hogs as an additional source of income. She is married and has four children. According to her, all her four children are currently attending school. Ginaline would like to buy more stock of cosmetic products, shoes, sandals, and perfumes but she doesn’t have enough capital. With regards to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes to use the loan for the continuous growth of her direct selling business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetic products, shoes, sandals, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Nguyet's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyet, born in 1976, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her daughter, and her son. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of her family and save a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy a breeding pig and food for the pig. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to invest in breeding effectively, and then next year she will sell from one to two tons of pig meat, bringing a considerable profit to her family.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig and food for the pig

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, 31 years old, is of the Kinh ethnic majority. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is breeding; each year she can sell about three pig herds with the income of over VND 100 million. However, the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and save a small amount from the income. She wants to expand the pig-breeding model but she does not have enough money to buy a breeding pig. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and then the next pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to expand the pig-breeding business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
For 10 years, Bernard has worked in agricultural production. He wakes up every day to go to work and care for his land. This is a skill that he learned on his own and, little by little, has perfected his techniques and abilities in this field. Benard is dedicated in full to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. He knows that many people consume his farm products, and because of this, he makes sure his products are pure and of good quality.

He is a 29-year-old farmer from Kipsaiya village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives with his wife and children on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, his primary sources of income have been milk and produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Benard made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities.

Sometime this month, he applied for a loan to buy seeds and expand his horticultural farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Benard's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung, 43 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2000, and she currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. The income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and to save a small amount from the income. She intends to raise fighting cock mixed chickens but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time. She expects that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and when selling the next chicken flock it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise fighting cock mixed chickens

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita has grown corn crops and a variety of vegetables for 10 years. She is married and had three children. She and her husband have been working hard to sustain their daily needs. Estrelita also raises hogs and has motorcycle transport.

This time, she would like to focus herself into her vegetable vending, since it's her family's primary source of income. She plans to purchase farm inputs and a variety vegetable seeds to maintain her vegetable farmland.

To keep her vegetable vending business growing continuously, she is asking for financial assistance amountintg to PHP15,000. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan amount. In this way, she could sustain her family's basic needs and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer and insecticides needed for her vegetable farmland

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 60 years old and married with five children. Avelina works very hard to provide for them.

Avelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, breads, cooking oil, shampoo, etc.

Avelina has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, breads, cooking oil, and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise a breeding buffalo

loans.name: Thuong's Group

texts.en:
Thuong, who was born in 1970, is an ethnic Thai woman that joined the M7 Microfinance Institution program in January 2012. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly on farming, so the income from each crop after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. Because Thuong has to pay for her daughter’s education fees at a college, the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Thuong will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan will help her daughter succeed at her studies, and then when she graduates, find a stable job with good salary.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education fees.

loans.name: Thasala Group

texts.en: Phone is excited to purchase a water filter on an affordable payment plan. Phone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Phone and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years. Phone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totalling up the costs, Phone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of five members including her husband, her son-in-law, her daughter and a child of her daughter. They are now living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her civil servant salary so it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for her coffee field but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family tend the coffee field well and in the next crop, it will bring a yield twice as much as the last crop. She will work hard in her job to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 45 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Edna has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, rope, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, rope, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Tahaback Group

texts.en: Vanhdee understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Vanhdee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes both natural and financial resources. The water filter Vanhdee purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially reducing expenses for charcoal. The filter will also save the family time foraging for firewood. Vanhdee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – he and his group can continue to receive the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase amTerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with one child and her only child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She doesn’t have any other additional income. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulting. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 12 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a  bale of used clothes

loans.name: Shanitah

texts.en: Shanitah is married with one child and her child goes to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX to buy a bale of used clothes. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to work with MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Sovandara

texts.en: Sovandara is a 23-year-old single student who is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in Electrical Engineering in his third year at a university in the city. He is from the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. His parents are farmers. Now Sovandara is lacking the money to cover his university fees from the third to the fifth year, so he has decided to take out a loan. With this loan, he will have enough money to earn a Bachelor’s degree and graduate successfully. After graduation, he is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the third to the fifth year

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulting. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business selling pancakes and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cassava flour, yellow bananas, and cooking oil. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works from home and sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the increasing prices of cooking oil and cassava flour. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO so as to get additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, yellow bananas, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agnes is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market seven days a week and on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Phontan Group

texts.en: Khamfong’s village sources much of the drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamfong and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khamfong and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Khamfong’s family, will identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phuc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuc, 50 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the civil servant salary of the married couple, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She is studying at a university in the evening so she has to pay much for her education fees but her savings amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for the fee for the next term.

She hopes the loan amount will help her have money to pay for her education fee and when she graduates she will have a high and stable salary.

loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Ivery

texts.en:
Ivery is 49 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She buys a variety of vegetables from the local farmer and sells it at the market to earn living. She has been doing this for two years.

Ivery requested a loan to buy vegetables such as cabbage, salad, tomatoes, shallots, onions as well as an umbrella to assist her in running the business. With the profits she makes, Ivery plans to improve her home and also help cover her family's daily expenses.

She recently join SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, shallots, tomatoes, onions and also a umbrella  for her market business.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is a single mother of four children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She sells banana leaves and fingers and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of banana leaves and green banana fingers. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include the increasing prices of green bananas. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO so as to get additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of banana leaves and green banana fingers

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a married mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week and on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, mangoes and pineapples. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perishability of fruits. She aspires to build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 60 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell like eggs, noodles, canned goods, bread, milk, and coffee. 

Rosela has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell like eggs, noodles, canned goods, bread, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, 45 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI since 2010. She lives with her husband and her daughter in the Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from selling fresh fish, meat, and raising chickens to get food for the family. Because the revenue for selling vegetables is not good, the income is just enough to cover food of the family.  Mrs. Ly wants to expand to raising pigs. She does not have enough money, so she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes this loan will help her family invest effectively in high productivity breeding. Additionally, for herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise pigs.

loans.name: Phonthong Group

texts.en:
Somphan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up the costs, Somphan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter they have purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. 

Somphan is happy the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Songkhonemai Group

texts.en:
Heuang understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Heuang has purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent on buying charcoal, and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, which is not always available.

Heuang is excited that the filter has been purchased on an affordable repayment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Josephine has an oyster culture business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Yvony

texts.en:
Yvony is 50 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, bread, cooking oil, shampoo, etc.

Yvony has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling jewellery.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, bread, cooking oil, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Myrna Lee

texts.en:
Myrna Lee is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Myrna Lee has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages and other food products

loans.name: Milou

texts.fr: Milou, 39 ans, vit en union libre. Il a un enfant. Il y a treize ans de cela, il a décidé de mettre sur pied une activité afin de pouvoir répondre générer des revenus pour répondre à ses besoins. Il a démarré l’entreprise en vendant des vêtements et des chaussures neufs. Grace au microcrédit, il a beaucoup développé son commerce.  Il demande un microcrédit pour faire l’acquisition d’un nouvel arrivage de chaussures.
texts.en:
Milou, who is 39 years old, has a partner and a child. 

It has been 13 years since he decided to start his own business, selling new shoes and clothing, so that he could generate an income to meet his needs. 

Thanks to micro-loans, he has been able to develop his business a lot. He is seeking this loan to procure a new arrival of shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Fayda Group

texts.fr: Salamata est âgée de 33 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Restauratrice depuis 6 ans. Elle habite dans une zone périphérique de la ville où elle est seule à faire cette activités, elle prépare de la bonne nourriture (riz, la soupe, la boisson) c’est tout ça qui fait que son activité marche très bien. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 03 sacs de riz, 05 cartons de spaghetti, 05 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 10 caisses de boisson. L’utilité du prêt d’approvisionner son restaurant en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 9 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Salamata is 33 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has run a restaurant for six years. She lives in one of the outer areas of the town, where she is the only one with a restaurant. 

She prepares good food (rice, soup, drinks), which makes her business do very well. She wants this loan to buy three sacs of rice, five cartons of spaghetti, five 20-liter drums of oil, and 10 cases of drinks.

This loan will allow her to stock her restaurant with enough to satisfy her customers. 

She has already received nine loans and has reimbursed them all on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, spaghetti, drums of oil, and drinks

loans.name: Lantomalala

texts.fr:
38 ans, mariée, Lantomalala est une mère de famille très attentionnée et très travailleuse. Elle a quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés.
Lantomalala dirige une petite boucherie depuis l'an 2000 pour gagner sa vie, et son marie aussi effectue la même activité qu'elle. Au fait, c'est le point de vente que le mari tenait auparavant qu'elle gère en ce moment.
La famille a donc deux différents points de vente actuellement.
Elle demande un prêt qui va lui permettre de renforcer le fonds de roulement, elle voudrait augmenter les quantités et diversifier les marchandises à proposer.
Son rêve est de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une meilleure éducation, les faire réussir dans leurs études et une meilleure condition de vie. La famille a déjà pu construire une maison avec ses propres épargnes.
texts.en:
Lantomalala is 38 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She is very caring and hardworking. She has four children, of whom three are in school.

Lantomalala has run a small butcher shop since 2000 as a way to earn a living. Her husband also works in the same line of business. They have two points of sale. And she runs the point of sale that her husband used to run. 

She is seeking a loan to increase her cash flow. She would like to increase and diversify her stock. 

Her dream is to be able to offer her children a better education, help them succeed with their studies, and to provide a better quality of life. The family has already been able to build a house with their own savings.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Barimalala Dina

texts.fr:
25 ans, célibataire sans enfants, Barimalala Dina est une jeune femme très simple mais très travailleuse. Elle vie avec ses parents actuellement et ces derniers sont  en partie à sa charge.
Elle dirige un petit quincaillerie depuis 2008 pour gagner sa vie. Elle demande un crédit pour pouvoir développer et améliorer son affaire. Elle voudrait renouveler ses stocks de marchandises (augmenter les quantités et diversifier les articles à proposer).
Comme toutes jeunes filles de son âge, elle envisage de fonder une famille un jour, avoir d'enfants, et elle prépare déjà en ce moment un avenir solide pour son propre futur ménage.
texts.en:
Barimalala Dina is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She is a very simple woman, but very hardworking. She lives with her parents and helps to take care of them. 

She has run a small hardware store since 2008 to earn a living. She is seeking a loan to be able to develop and improve her business.

She would like to renew her stock (by increasing the quantity and diversifying). 

Like all young women her age, she hopes to start a family one day and have children. She is already preparing for a solid future for her household.

loans.use: to buy lamps, sockets, cables, switches, and light bulbs

loans.name: Helmine

texts.fr:
Mère de famille avec deux enfants, 30 ans,Helmine est une femme dynamique et travailleuse. Son mari est marchand de tissu et quant à elle, elle exerce une activité de vente ambulante et fixe de chaussures à l'occasion. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2002, auparavant, pendant quelques années c'est à dire avant son mariage elle a déjà aidé ses parents dans leur commerce. Son projet est de développer et étendre son activité. Elle est à son 4ème prêt avec CEFOR. Les trois précédents sont remboursés régulièrement sans difficulté.
Elle a déjà pu construire une petite maison d'une pièce avec les bénéfices procurées de l'activité et une partie de ses épargnes. Et elle projette d'acheter un autre terrain et construire une autre 2ème maison plus tard.
texts.en:
A mother of a family with two children, Helmine is 30 years old and is very dynamic and hardworking. Her husband works selling fabric, and, as for her, she works selling used shoes, by traveling around and from a fixed place. She started this business in 2002. Before that, for some years, before she was married, she helped her parents in their commerce.

Her goal is to develop and expand her business. She is on her fourth loan with CEFOR. The previous three loans were repaid on time and without difficulty. 

She has already been able to build a small one-room house with the earnings from her business and her savings. 

Her goal is to buy another piece of land and build another second house later.

loans.use: to buy used shoes

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr: Sur la photo, Konimba est la femme à droite en tenant des échantillons des articles de la boutique. Elle a 35 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants de 1 à 14 ans dont  5 écoliers. Elle vend la boutique, son mari est un cultivateur. Konimba fait recourt au prêt pour acheter plus des articles de la boutique  enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle exerce ce travail depuis 8 ans. Elle est analphabète mais Konimba se souci de la  scolarisation de ses enfants. Le prêt lui aide à subvenir à ses charges familiales ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants  grâce aux bénéfices générés. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de sa localité  et ses ventes se vont en détail au bord du goudron et au marché de sa localité. Elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000f CFA .
texts.en:
In the photo, Konimba is the woman on the right holding some sample goods from her shop. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, aged from one to 14 years old. Five of the children are in school.

Konimba sells goods from her shop, while her husband is a farmer. She has done this work for eight years. 

She is seeking a loan to buy more goods for her shop, so that she can earn more profits. 

Konimba cannot read or write, but she cares about her children's education. This loan will help her to support her family's expenses, especially her children's school fees, by generating earnings.

She procures her goods at a local market, and sales are made at retail from the side of the road and from a local market. She earns an average profit of 20,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Relwende Gandaogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr GANDAOGO est responsable du groupe RELWENDE GANDAOGO. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 04 vont à l'école. Il a 08 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 06ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 07 sacs d’engrais et 10 boites d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison d’habitation (une villa). Mr ambitionne s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Gandaogo is the leader of the Relwende Gandaogo group. Married, he is the father of four children, aged from seven to 22 years old. All of the children go to school. He takes care of eight people.

Gandaogo has been market gardening for six years. He procures his supplies from the village. [With this loan], he wants to buy seven sacs of fertilizer and ten bottles of herbicide. 

He wants to use his earnings to educate his children and to build a house (a villa). His goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Bonswende Barkie Group

texts.fr:
Mr BARKIE est responsable du groupe BONSWENDE BARKIE. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 05 vont à l'école. Il a 07personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 20 ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 02 sacs d’engrais.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Barkie is the leader of the Bonswende Barkie group. Married, he is the father of six children, aged from three to 21 years old. Five of the children are in school. He takes care of seven people. 

Barkie has been market gardening for 20 years. He procures his supplies in the village. He wants to buy two sacs of fertilizer [with this loan].

He wants to use his earnings to strengthen his farming. His goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Association Nongtaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMADY est responsable du groupe ASSOCIATION NONGTAABA. Marié, il est père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 02 vont à l'école. Il a 13 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 10ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 02 sacs d’engrais.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mahamady is the leader of the Association Nongtaaba group. Married, he is the father of five children, aged from seven to 14 years old. Two of the children are in school. He takes care of 13 people.

Mahamady has been market gardening for 10 years. He procures his supplies from the village. 

Mahamady wants to buy two sacs of fertilizer [with this loan]. He wants to use his earnings to strengthen his work. 

His goal is to have a house.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Yanaganle Group

texts.fr:
Marie est la dame qui a sa main sur le mouton sur la photo, Elle est  une malienne âgée de 32ans, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, âgés de 4 à 9 ans, dont un(01) scolarisée. Son mari est un cultivateur.  Marie fait des élevages des ovins, Elle sollicite un prêt au R.M.C.R dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons, les élever puis les revendre. Elle a 6 ans d’activités.
 Elle  fait ses achats et  ses ventes dans les foires de sa localité, son bénéfice lui permettra de prendre en charge certaines dépenses(les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants, l’habillement,  santé et  condiment) au sein  de sa famille. Elle est souvent confronter à des  situations de méventes et relève les défis avec un revendeur de sa localité. 
Dans les jours à venir Marie aimerait avoir un prêt  plus élevé, mener une grande activité d’élevage, afin d’avoir plus de profits et acheter un taxi moto pour ses activités.
texts.en:
Marie is the woman who has her hand on the sheep in the photo. She is 32 years old, from Mali, married, and the mother of three children, aged from four to nine years old. One of the children is in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Marie raises livestock, and she is seeking a loan with RMCR in the hopes to buy more sheep, which she will raise and then resell. She has done this type of work for six years. 

She makes her purchases and her sales in the weekly markets. Earnings allow her to take care of some of her family's expenses (her children's school fees, clothing, healthcare, and food). 

Marie is often confronted with poor sales and has some challenges regarding one of the other local resellers. 

In the future, Marie would love to have a larger loan and run a larger business, so that she can earn more profits, with which she can buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy animals to resell after

loans.name: Gladis Corina

texts.es: Gladis de 31 años de edad,  vive con su compañero de vida y junto a sus hijos  de 10 y 3 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace más de cuatro  años en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante y ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora, honrada y muy responsable, su negocio tiene mucha demanda gracias a la calidad de sus productos además por la amabilidad con la que se los ofrece a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares. Gladis solicita un crédito a FUSAI para el mejoramiento de su negocio que consiste en comprar: perfumes, tintes para el cabello, cremas para la piel, etc., y además poder ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos y así mejorar su nivel de ventas, obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 31 years old and lives with her life partner and her children, who are 10 and 3 years old. She has worked selling beauty products from a catalogue for more than four years both from home and door-to-door, and she has demonstrated that she is a hard-working, honest and very responsible person. Her business is very in demand thanks to the quality of her products as well as the kindness which she offers to her customers. Thanks to her work she has managed to pay off some of her family expenses.
Gladis is asking for a loan with FUSAI for the improvement of her business, which consists of buying perfumes, hair dyes, skin creams, etc., as well as to be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products. She will thereby improve her level of sales to obtain a better income which will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, hair dyes, skin creams, etc.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Por Una Esperanza Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Por una Esperanza se formó en Shiroles, comunidad indígena de Talamanca. Está conformado por nueve socias de la misma comunidad y que se conocen muy bien entre si. Todas las socias indígenas. Logran asociarse para conseguir bienes en común como es el financiamiento por parte de Fundación Mujer para sus diferentes actividades productivas, algunas las tienen ya iniciadas y otra cuentan con la experiencia para emprenderlas. Escogieron el nombre porque para ellas es una esperanza de llegar a crecer en sus negocios por medio del crédito. Ellas van a trabajar en los sectores de comercio y agropecuario. Son señoras muy trabajadoras y con deseos de superación. Viven en esa comunidad, la cual tienen muchas carencias y algunas actividades que realizan las señoras son de subsistencia. La mayoria realizan sus labores en familia, debido a que la principal fuente de ingresos en ellas es la agricultura del plátano y banano. Es la primera vez que van a solicitar financiamiento en la Fundación y se unieron para lograr entrar al programa del crédito grupal con la garantía solidaria debido a que se les dificulta obtner un crédito individual por la falta de garantía. Isabel es una de las socias activas y tiene 26 años, madre de tres hijos y jefa de hogar. Mujer trabajadora y esforzada por lograr sus metas. Es la secretaria del grupo. Tiene la experiencia  en la venta ambulante de ropa de mujer y hombre. Ahora integra el grupo para reiniciar la actividad, debido a que no cuenta con un ingreso suficiente para salir adelante con sus hijos. Por éste motivo emprende su negocio, ya que tiene toda la obligación o carga económica con su familia. Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, al igual que las demás socias. Junto con ella hay ocho mujeres más que buscan los mismos objetivos en común, y van a invertir en el comercio como bazar, una soda, cria de cerdos y siembra de plátano y banano.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Women for Hope" was formed in Shiroles, an indigenous community in Talamanca, Costa Rica.  It is made up of 9 members from the same community who know each other very well.  All of the members are native peoples (indígenas).  They work together in an association in order to gain resources in common, such as financing from Kiva's partner Fundación Mujer, for their different economic activities.  Some already have their businesses going while others have the experience to begin new ones.    

They chose their name because their hope is to grow their businesses through the assistance of loans.  They are going to work in the sectors of commerce and agriculture.  They are very hard-working women with desires to succeed.  They live in a community that lacks many things, and some of the micro-businesses of these women involve subsistence. 

The majority of the women work at home with their families, since the principle source of income is the cultivation of plantains and bananas.  This is the first time that they are asking for a loan from Kiva's partner and they came together in order to enter into the group credit program with the guarantee of solidarity since it is difficult for them to obtain personal loans as they don't have collateral without the group.  

Isabel is one of the active members.  She is 26 years old, the mother of three children, and head of her household.  She is a hard-working woman who is focused on meeting her goals. 

She is the secretary for the group.  She has experience in sales as a walking saleswoman offering women and men's clothing.  She has joined the group to restart that activity, since she does not have sufficient income to help her children get ahead.  For this reason she is beginning her business, since she has the obligation or economic responsibility for her family.  

One of her goals is to improve the living conditions of her family, her own home, and that of her group members.  Along with Isabel there are 8 other women who seek the same objectives in common, and who are going to invest in businesses such as working in a bazaar, selling soda, raising pigs and growing plantains and bananas.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for women and men, and to help other small businesses in a bazaar, selling soda, raising pigs and growing plantains and bananas.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Ll Las Cruces Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 42 años  casada, vive junto a sus 4 hijos en una comunidad denominada Suchitepéquez.
Juana (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa verde) es una de las pocas mujeres que tiene una visión muy clara en la vida, que es superarse para el bien de su familia, ella para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de tortilla y atol, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde la comunidad de su casa, tiene 6 años de realizarlo, de esta forma contribuye al sostenimiento de su hogar.
Juana gracias a la delicadeza con el que prepara los alimentos para venderlos cuenta con muchos clientes, pues su carisma y amabilidad hace que la gente busque sus deliciosas tortillas y atol, ella con el afán de brindarle a los clientes mejores servicios a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cacao, leña para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Juana para superarse, tiene como meta poder comprar un  terreno donde sus hijos puedan construir sus casas.
texts.en:
Juana is part of the communal banking group "Las Cruces".  She is a 42 year-old woman who is married and lives with her four children in a town called Suchitepéquez.  Juana (the first woman on the left side, and  wearing a green blouse) is a woman who has a very clear vision for her life, which is to get ahead for the good of her family.  She dedicates herself to selling tortillas and a cornflower drink called "atol" in order to help her family get head.  She has been working in this field for 6 years and she works in the community near her home.  In this way she contributes to the sustenance of her household.  

Juana has many customers thanks to the delicacy with which she prepares her food for sale.  Her charisma and kindness make people look for her delicious tortillas and atol.  Juana has decided to request a loan in order to offer her customers better service.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, cacao, and wood in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.  

Juana wants to succeed. One goal is to be able to purchase a plot of land where her children can build their homes.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cacao, and wood in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Meet Susan. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Kapsowar in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her secondary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children.

Ten years ago, Susan started farming on her husband's two-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her fifteen liters of milk every day for sale. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food and to also sell.

Susan is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce additional milk for sale. This investment will not only double the income that Susan is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which are her highest expenses. Consider lending a loan to Susan to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Grupo San Pablo Salida Madremia Group

texts.es:
Balvina es una mujer de 46 años de edad, ella vive junto a su hermosa familia en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Balvina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto de blusa azul)  es una madre que trabaja duro para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos, ella lo hace con el propósito de que sus hijos vivan mejor, Balvina es una mujer que aprovecha su tiempo ella se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus oficios domésticos, y en el trascurso del día se dedica a venta de tortilla y venta de abarrotes, pues ella con el primer préstamo que tuvo en ADICLA se propuso ser más creativa con su trabajo, para generar más ingresos y poder pagar el primero préstamo, pero con el afán de brindar un buen servicio solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más productos de abarrotes como azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas.
El gran sueño de balvina es que su tienda incremente para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Balvina is part of the communal banking group "San Pablo Salida Madremia".  She is a 46 year-old woman who lives together with her beautiful family in the community of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  Balvina (the first woman on the left and wearing a blue blouse) is a mother who works hard to help her husband by providing a source of income.  She does it with the goal of helping her children to live better.  Balvina is a woman who takes advantage of her time.  She gets up very early to complete her domestic tasks, and in the course of the day she works selling tortillas and snacks.  With the first loan that she received from Kiva's field partner ADICLA she proposed becoming more creative with her job in order to generate more income and be able to pay off her first loan.  However, with the aim of offering better services she is requesting a new loan in order to purchase products such as sugar, candy and sodas.  Her great dream is that her store will grow and she will be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, candy and sodas.

loans.name: Sovantheany

texts.en:
Sovantheany is a 20-year-old single student and she is from Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. She is studying accounting in her third year at university in the city. Her parents are farmers.

Now Sovantheany is lacking the finances to pay her tuition fees from her third year through her fourth year, so she has decided to take out a loan. With this loan, she will have enough money to earn a bachelor’s degree and graduate successfully.

After graduation, she is going to find a good job with a decent salary in the city, so she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from her third year through her fourth year.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. Ruby is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ruby has been in this business for four years now, and she also earns additional income from general store.

Ruby requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 46 years old, married and has one child. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She sells varieties of vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, ginger, green paper and shallot at the market to earn living. Caroline has been doing this for one year.

Caroline needs a loan to buy more vegetables to assist her in running the business. She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's daily expenses.

She joined SPBD this year to gain financial services.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, shallot and potatoes for her marketing business.

loans.name: Sovankhemry

texts.en:
Sovankhemry is 20 years old, single and from Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. Currently, she is studying accounting in her third year at a university in the city. Her parents are farmers who earn their main income from their rubber plantation.

Sovankhemry is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI because she needs the money to pay for her university fees from the third through fourth year.

After graduation, she hopes to find a good job in the city.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees from the third through fourth year.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, 45, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cristina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Cristina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Edna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Edna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.

Edna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 59 years old, widowed and has five children.

Eleanor is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Eleanor requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elien

texts.en:
Elien, 43, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elien has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Elien requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Evelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 59-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Helen has been in this business for 11 years and would like to save money to expand it.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 41-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members.

Fouzia has been running her own beauty salon for ten years. She contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Fouzia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items needed in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gricelda Evely

texts.es:
Gricelda, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito por el buen servicio que le brinda la institución, además siente que se le respalda cuando lo necesita, con el capital podrá comprar zacate picado y concentrado para alimentar al ganado, el resto le servirá para arreglar la cerca del terreno en que mantiene al ganado, espera seguir trabajando sin dificultades.
El préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar la ganadería, cuenta que aumento las cabezas de ganado y además comercializo las vacas que tenían mayor edad, sus ingresos son mejores y da a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Gricelda has decided to ask for a new loan because of the good service that the institution has given her. She feels like they back her when she needs it. With this capital, she will be able to buy chopped grass and animal feed to feed the cattle, the rest will be used to fix the fence on the land where she keeps the cattle. She hopes to be able to keep working without difficulties.
The previous loan was very helpful to improve her livestock, she says she increased the number of animals and she also sold the older cows. Her income is better, and she can give her family better food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to buy chopped grass and animal feed to feed the cattle, and to fix a fence on the land where she keeps the cattle.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie and her husband are farmers and are blessed with one child. Lanie manages a fish pond and farm land. She rents the pond for 15,000 Philippines pesos every six months. In addition, she grows a variety of vegetables, including corn. With her determination to have a profitable and progressive business, Lanie is asking for financial assistance amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and fish feed. She hopes that she can obtain a better income and improve her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and fish feed

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 34-years-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and three kids; in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Raed would like to start another business which is transporting and distributing goods. So he requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. This will enable him to increase his income and also his family living conditions. 
Raed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
ABADACOGORA a group led by Elina who is 56 years old. The group name means “They don't give up” in English. She is married with 4 children aged between 19 and 29 years. She owns a shop and has been doing in a business for the past 13 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years. She is a widow and has two children. She sells fruits and vegetables which she grows herself. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to service the loan and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the fruits and vegetables that she grows for sale

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Sector Loma Paculam Group

texts.es:
Catarina (es la primera del lado izquierdo) es una mujer tenaz, luchadora con una visión clara de la vida; ella trabaja muy duro para alcanzar sus sueños. A sus 35 años tiene todo el deseo y la energía de salir adelante
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica en la comunidad donde vive; la labor lo realiza en su comunidad y en lugares circunvecinos; empezó a ejercer esta actividad hace cinco años y lo aprendió de sus padres y amigos; llevo a cabo esta actividad porque es el medio  que le ayuda a generar los ingresos económicos necesarios para su sustento. En estos años se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad tiene mucha demanda, principalmente en su comunidad porque todas las personas que viven cerca de ella utilizan este tipo de vestimenta; con el afán de prosperar con su negocio solicita un préstamo para surtir mejor su negocio, compra  más ropa típica.
Uno de sus principales anhelos o sueños es que en un futuro su negocio incremente como también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Catarina is part of the communal banking group "Mujeres Sector Loma Paculam".  She is the first woman on the left in the picture and is a tenacious. hard-working woman with a clear vision of life.  She works very hard in order to achieve her dreams.  At 35 years-old she has a great desire and energy to succeed.   

She works buying and selling traditional clothing in the community where she lives. She works in her community and in surrounding areas.  She began this work five years ago and she learned it from her parents and friends.  She participates in this work because it is the method that helps her generate the income necessary to sustain her household.  In recent years she has realized that this activity is in great demand, principally in her community, because everyone who lives close to her wears traditional dress.  With the goal of growing her business she is asking for a loan in order to supply her business better and to buy more traditional clothing.

One of her principle desires and dreams is that in the future she will grow her business and expand her earnings.

loans.use: To buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Benovsha

texts.en:
Benovsha is 48 years old and married. She is the mother of one son and two daughters. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. She is skilled and steadily women.

Benovsha is a dairy farmer. She started keeping dairy cows 15 years ago and started this business with an amount of small capital. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve and expand her merchandise. 

Now Benovsha wants to buy a few sheep because she will sell their wool. In this way she believes her business will be expand. So Benovsha needs some money for that and she hopes Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy a few sheep because she will sell their wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, wire for electric current, switches, lamps, etc. in order to pour a cement floor for her home and install electric power.

loans.name: Gavharbi

texts.en:
Gavharbi is a careful mother. She was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is now living in big city with her family, where she is married and has four children. She is a nurse at a medical clinic. She is responsible, punctual and talented person. Always tries to be helpful and supportive. 

The school season is coming and she is responsible to buy uniform for her children. Her salary is small and is not enough to buy uniform to her children. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy uniform to her children for school. She wishes to be understood and supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy uniforms for her children for school

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 18-years-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ismael has a rickshaw where he uses it for transporting and distributing goods. It is a good business and provides him with a good income.

Ismael requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new Rickshaw for his business. This will enable him to increase his productivity and also his income.
Ismael appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a 59-year-old married woman from Badian, Cebu. Her husband is a farmer while she sells food. She has been in this business of selling food for 10 years and earns about PHP4000 per month. 

Estrella is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as pork, vegetables, flour and spices. She also buys soft drinks and purified water out from the money she is requesting. Estrella’s dream in the future is to expand her business and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, flour, spices, soft drinks and purified water

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 51 years old, married and has two children. He has set up a small sari-sari store at the front of his house. Although he only earns a small income, it is just what his family needs. Now, an opportunity has presented itself for him to take out a loan to buy more goods to have a greater income. 

In the future, Oscar plans to save money to sustain his daily needs and to pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his store

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene is from Badian, Cebu and owns a sari-sari store for ten years. She is a 55-year-old married woman and has one child. 

Darlene is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery items such as biscuits, chips, candies, bread, soft drinks, powdered juice and toiletries. Aside from selling grocery items, Darlene sells food like fried fish, fried egg, soup, noodles and orange juice. Darlene’s future plan is to expand her business and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chips, candies, bread, soft drinks, powdered juice and toiletries

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Herminia has been in this business for ten years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is aged 57, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a weaver and makes blankets at home. For weaving blankets, wool is used in making them. There is no better kind of the blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones. 

Her husband is very expert and weaves very fine blankets. This is very slow and time demanding procedure and the demand for fine blankets has been increasing time to time.

However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for blankets making but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. 
Therefore, Rasheeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for blankets and it could become the cause to increase his income.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband blanket business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-years-old single man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. All his brothers work in the family agricultural land. They plant olive trees and some seasonal fruits. 

Mahmoud would like to start another business which is transporting and distributing goods. So he requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. This will enable him to increase his income and also his family living conditions. 
Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Emanuel, who is in his early 40s is married with with three children, two of them are in school and one is still small.  He has been running a restaurant business for three years now.  He works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the food and drinks in his restaurant and has paid back all his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase the drinks and food stock in the restaurant.  He dreams of owning a big cafeteria.

Emanuel will share this loan with his loan group Trust which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the drinks and food stock in the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered milk, sugar, coffee, toiletries, diaper, mosquito repellent, soft drinks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old and is not married. He has had an Agrovet and farm supplies business and has been selling and supplyng to the farmers for the past 1 year. 

He will be using the loan to add stock of veterinary medicine, fertilizers and seeds for sell to farmers and hopes this will enable him to get more income to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are open another business.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicine, fertilizers and seeds for sell to farmers and hopes this will enable him to get more income to expand his business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mildred is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mildred has a general store business in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mildred has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.
