She has a buy and sell corn in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more corn to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Susan dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running their own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years and is responsible for meeting the needs of the entire family.
He needs to buy different types of tailoring materials such as pieces of cloth, needles and sewing machine accessories, but cannot afford to do this. Thus, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will assist her husband to buy the materials his business needs, so that he can earn more income.

Shamim is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this assistance,.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Abahujumutima Group

texts.en:
Marie is a group leader,aged 55. She is married with 7 children aged 15-31, 4 of them go to school. The group is called ABAHUJUMUTIMA means “feel altogether” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for selling

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is single mother, 31 years old with a 12 years old child.

Grace has been the one providing for her child. At first through her job as a laundress in a laundry shop. Grace works hard and save most of her money so that she may able buy a washing machine and put up her own laundry shop to increase her income. Through her hard work she was able to set up a laundry shop with 1 secondhand washing machine and through time Grace was able to put up 3 washing machine and earn about PhP 1,000-2,000 daily.

Grace's business is not easy. She washes clothes, irons them and delivers them to her customers while supporting and taking care of her child. But grace determination of providing for her child and her old parents in the provinces keeps her to improve more of herself and her business. 

Grace challenges most of the time is having her 2 secondhand washing machine that are broken and cannot be used for washing clothes, so she manually wash the clothes to be deliver to her customers on time.

Grace is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 15,000 to buy 5 big packs powder detergent, 2 gallons fabric conditioner and to repair her 2 secondhand washing machine to be used again for business.

Grace hopes to add another washing machine to accommodate more laundry to increase her income so that she can support her child and her family.

loans.use: To buy 5 big packs powder detergent, 2 gallons fabric conditioner and to repair her 2 secondhand washing machine to be used again for business

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO,el banco pertenece al distrito de Lamay,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Feliciana tiene 35 años de edad  es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de  animales menores, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
The borrower is part of the El Triunfo communal bank. The bank is in Lamay district, Calca province, and Cusco department.

The borrower, Feliciana, is 35 years old, partnered and has 2 children. The borrower alternates her daily chores with her business raising small animals. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower has had her business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her business each day. This is the way that the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase animals and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO,el banco pertenece al distrito de Lamay,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Norberto  tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de agricultura, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
The borrower is part of the El Triunfo communal bank. The bank is in the district of Lamay, Claca province, and Cusco department.

The borrower, Norberto, is 41 years old, partnered and has 2 children. He alternates his daily chores with agricultural sales. He is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower has had this business for a good while, which is going well for him thanks to the determination he puts into his business each day. This is the way that the member gets his family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase manure and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seeds.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO,el banco pertenece al distrito de Lamay,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Teodora  tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the El Triunfo communal bank. The bank is in Lamay district, Calca province, and Cusco department.

The borrower, Teodora, is 38 years old and is partnered. The borrower alternates her daily chores with her business of agricultural sales. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the determination she puts into her business each day. This is the way that the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase manure and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seeds.

loans.name: Shardrack

texts.en:
Shardrack is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He does farming, growing maize, beans and green grams as well as livestock trade. He has been in the business for two years and it has been profitable. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to use the loan to buy livestock for selling and hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family. He will use the profit from his business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future is to grow his farming business,make more income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock for selling and hopes this will enable him to make more income to pay school fees for his children and provide for his family's needs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 46, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Arnold, a driver, and has one child in high school and one in elementary school. Her family lives in the highlands of Cavite, where there is cool weather and fertile soil. This has led Nida to grow ornamental plants and sell them along the highway. 

Nida has been in this business for ten years already, growing garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the surrounding community.

To help her expand her farm, she is requesting a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers and various kinds of garden seedlings to grow beautiful and healthy ornamental plants. She expects a boost to her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help meet the family's daily needs and fund her children's education. Although there are days that her sales are low, she continues to trust the Lord that she will have higher sales on other days.

Nida hopes to attract more customers. She aims to send her children to college and see them become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening supplies.

loans.name: Güloz

texts.en:
Güloz is 36 years old and a mother of two.  In order to enable the education of her children, she is selling simit (Turkish bagel).  With the help of her loans and her 4th loan from Maya she has made a heater to her handcart to sell warm simit and she also needs to change the tires of her cart.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Güloz Hanım 36 yaşında ve iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarını okula gönderebilmek için simit satışı yapıyor.  Mayada 4. kredisini kullanan Güloz hanım kredileri ile simit arabasına ısıtıcı yaptırdı sıcak simit satmak için.  Daha sonra arabasının tekerleklerini değiştirdi.

loans.use: to buy a heater for her Simit hand cart

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 18-years-old single man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his family in a small house. His brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Momen would like to start a business which is transporting and distributing goods. So he requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his new business. This will enable him to increase his income and also his family living conditions.
Momen appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and bolts to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma de 40 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 10 años de edad. Norma se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y además presta sus servicios en un puesto de comida realizando la labor de cocinera y atención al cliente, es de esta forma como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Norma con el deseo de  construir un cuarto para la cocina y encementar la entrada principal de su vivienda solicito un crédito anteriormente el cual le fue de gran ayuda ya que vio cumplido su sueño y gracias a su buena experiencia ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, grava y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto dormitorio ya que sus hijos van creciendo rápidamente y desea brindarles una mayor comodidad, además aprovechar el espacio de la su vivienda para ampliar su casa.
texts.en: Norma, 40 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children, ages 13, 11, and 10. Norma works selling beauty products from catalogs and also works at a food stand as a cook and in customer service. It is in this way that she earns her living and brings sustenance to her home. Norma, with the desire to build a room for the kitchen and cement the front entrance of her house, asked for a previous loan which was a great help for her since she realized her dream.  Thanks to her good experience, she has decided to ask for another loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, metal, and gravel, and pay labor costs to build a bedroom since her children are growing quickly and she wants to offer them more comfort, in addition to taking advantage of the space of her land to expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, metal, and gravel, and to pay labor costs to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen posee una habilidad sorprendente para el comercio de mercancías varias, ella inició esta actividad motivada por su hermana quien fue su apoyo incondicional para incorporarse a la vida comercial; su hermana le facilitó prendas de vestir y le propuso que se las cancelara en la medida que realizara cobros a los clientes.  Poco a poco, logró consolidar su clientela entre sus amigas, vecinos, conocidos y su madre le ayudó a vender en el pueblo donde reside.  Así mismo, palpo la oportunidad de ofrecer desde su vivienda minutos a celular y  mekatos surtidos en una vitrina.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una vitrina mostradora y surtirla con prendas de vestir para toda la familia y accesorios.  Con esta inversión ella considera que incrementaran sus ventas, por la afluencia de personas que llegan a solicitar minutos y en ese instante estas personas observarían los productos y estarían tentados a comprar.  Su meta a futuro es tener su almacén de ropa y adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen has a surprising aptitude for business and selling merchandise. She was motivated to get started in this work by her sister. Carmen's sister has provided her with unconditional support in getting started with her business, loaning her money to buy clothing items for her and it was she who suggested that she pay her back as she made money selling the clothes. 

Little by little, Carmen has built up her customer base amongst her friends, neighbours and acquaintances. Her mother also helped her selling clothes in the town where she lives. As well as this, Carmen decided to sell mobile phone credit and a variety of snack food and candy from her home. 

Now Carmen is applying for her first loan with KIVA via Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She wants to use the loan to buy a glass showcase and stock it with family clothing and accessories. Carmen believes that this investment will increase her sales, many people come to buy phone credit and when they do, they are exposed to the other items that are for sale and tempted to buy. 

Carmen's goals for the future are to have her own general store and her own home.

loans.use: To buy a glass showcase and stock it with family clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 49 years old, from Kutaisi, the west of Georgia. She lives with her pensioner mother and she is the only source of income for them. 

Nino had been working in Turkey for several years and has just returned to Georgia. Nino and her mother find it hard to make the living-wage and tackle  their financial difficulties. Nino decided to request a financial support for providing the source of income for her family's welfare.

Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nino plans to renovate the commercial space she owns in the city and will rent it out for a good price. She will get the significant income for the new business and give her financial stability.
Nino and her mother rely on a good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate support and kindness.

loans.use: To renovate a commercial space and rent it out to provide an income

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, es un hombre muy esforzado de cincuenta y tres años de edad, que desde hace veintidós años ha trabajado como vendedor ambulante,  en la actualidad vende, controles remotos, billeteras, llaveros, DVDs, CD musicales, corta uñas, entre otras cosas. Poco a poco ha logrado crecer como comerciante. 
En estos momentos, ha recurrido a un préstamo de kiva junto a MiCrédito, para incursionar en la venta de un nuevo producto, de esta manera podra comprar lentes de sol y ofertarlos a sis clientes. Poco a poco va diversificando su negocio, en un futuro desea poner en su casa de habitación una tienda. Mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, ha sido su principal generador de energía para trabajar duro.
texts.en:
Mariano, is a man who works hard at fifty-three years of age, who for the past twenty-two years has worked as a street vendor. Currently he sells remote controls, wallets, key chains, DVDs, music CDs, nail clippers and other things. Little by little he has been able to grow as a salesperson.

Now, he has asked for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to start to sell a new product, in this way he will be able to purchase sunglasses to sell to his customers. Little by little he is diversifying his business, in the future he wants to establish a store in a room of his house. Improving his family's standard of living has been the principal source of energy for him to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase sunglasses.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazreen is the age of 51, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son has been running a mobile shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobiles as well as sells mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 
Nowadays, a lot of demand increase for mobile accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. 

But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he has spent his all income over household expenses. 
Therefore, she requested a loan for her son so he can be empower to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facility. 
Nazreen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile's accessories and extra credit for her son's mobile shop.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 21 years old and a single student who is from the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at the university in the city. 

Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the third year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, she dreams of saving money to run her own business and build her own proper house.

loans.use: to pay her 3rd year tuition fees in Finance and Banking

loans.name: José Eusebio

texts.es:
Don José tiene 57 años y tiene 5 hijos , es una persona muy entusiasta que participa en todas las reuniones y capacitaciones realizadas por la Asociación (APT del Norte), es técnico electricista le gusta mucho la agricultura orgánica porque esta contribuyendo al cuidado del medio ambiente y le trae grandes ingresos con los cuales ha podido educar a sus hijos . con 25 años en el cultivo de la tara y su participación en los distintos talleres de aprendizaje llevados a cabo por la asociación, al cual don josé pertenece se garantiza el éxito del negocio. el préstamo ayudara a mejorar la producción de tara, generando mayores ingresos en la economía familiar.
Su sueño a futuro es implementar mejor su galpón de cuyes y mejorar la raza de su ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and has 5 children. He is a very enthusiastic person who participates in all the meetings and training conducted by the association (APT of the North). He is an electric technician who likes organic agriculture a lot because it is contributing to the care of the environment and it brings a lot of income with which he has been able to educate his children. He has grown tara for 25 years and has participated in the various workshops carried out by the association, which have guaranteed José success in his business. The loan will help to improve his tara production, generating more income for the family economy.

His dream for the future is to improve his guinea pig shed and improve the breed of his cattle.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for the tara trees.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a farming business for 10 years.

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help her enlarge the business and to increase savings. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to create job opportunities and have better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to help her enlarge the business and to increase savings

loans.name: Concorcia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Concorcia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Concorcia is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Concorcia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Urugero Sub Group

texts.en:
URUGERO a group led by Sandrine who is 32 years old. The group name means “Journey” in English. She is married with 1 child who has 12 years. She owns a bar and has been doing in a business for the past 4 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda for sell.

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es:
Don José, es un hombre entregado a la vida del campo, desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño todo el trabajo que demanda cultivar. En sus propias tierras decidió emprender su negocio de agricultura.  Él se dedica a cultivar maíz, melón y ayote. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que utilizo para comprar abono, urea, entre otros insumos,  logro sacar adelante un cultivo de maíz, con el cual su negocio se vio fortalecido. 
En estos momentos, ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo que le permitirá pagar la mano de obra de la elaboración de un pozo de agua y la compra de los materiales como, piedra cantera, cemento y varillas de hierro. Dada la situación de sequía en el país, necesita garantizar un sistema de riego para el cultivo.
texts.en:
José is a man passionate about rural life. When he was very young, his father taught him all the work that cultivation requires. On his own land, he decided to undertake his agricultural business. He works growing corn, melons and pumpkins. Thanks to his first Kiva loan with MiCrédito, which he used to purchase manure, urea, and other supplies, he managed to get his corn crop ahead, with which his business was strengthened. 

Now, he has asked fro another loan which will allow him to pay labor costs to make a well and to purchase the materials such as quarry stone, cement and iron rebar. Given the drought situation in the country, he needs to guarantee an irrigation system for his crops.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to make a well and purchase the materials such as quarry stone, cement and iron rebar.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 31-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, a remote town with difficult living conditions. He owns a small inherited piece of land. On the land, he has kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for seven years. His main income sources are milk and crops. He recently ventured into a small side business to supplement the meager income he earns from mixed farming. 

From Kiva lenders, Reuben is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) to buy seeds and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by steadily rising exports. It is to support horticulture farmers that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to help Reuben access a loan that will aid him in expanding his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and aid the commercialization of the rural sector. 

With this loan, Reuben’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Reuben knows that, thanks to Juhudi Kilimo and the lenders from Kiva, he can achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, lingerie, footwear and more.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Sreymao is a married mother of three children and two among them are in school while one of them is too young to attend school. Nowadays, she is living in a rural area of Kratie province and she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income for six years. Sreymao is also working on her co-villager’s farm to earn additional income to complement her family’s needs. Due to her cassava crops have not grown well, it causes her to get the lower return than her expected. Sreymao is able to earn income from her businesses about 30,000KHR per day.  

Due to having not enough funds to do farming for this year, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a first loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she is willing to spend her loan portion to buy pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her crop well and gain more yields than previous years.

loans.use: to spend her loan portion to buy pesticide to protect her crop from insects.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is 48 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is the mother of two sons and five daughters  Her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business.

Bilqees's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy the scrape in bulk therefore Bilqees has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that her husband can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn profitable income derived from his business.

Bilqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan on this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's scrap recycling business

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO,el banco pertenece al distrito de Lamay,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Rudy  tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mototaxi, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su moto.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the EL TRIUNFO communal bank. The bank belongs to the district of Lamay, province of Calca and department of Cuzco. 
Rudy is 20 years old and he is single. He alternates between his daily life activities and his motorcycle taxi business. He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments on time. He has had this business for a long time and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his business every day. This is how he gets his family ahead.

He is asking for the loan to to maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO,el banco pertenece a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Zoila tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias, cebollas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO communal bank. The bank belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.


Zoila is 48 years old. She is single and alternates her daily activities with her vegetable selling business. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time. She has had this business for some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she is putting into her business every day. This is the way that she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy carrots, onions and more.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions, and more.

loans.name: Lelan

texts.es:
Lelan es un hombre joven de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de administración de empresas. 
Él es inteligente, emprendedora, dedicado, optimista, feliz, alegre, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en una escuela superior de estudios ubicada en la zona ‘pampahasi’ sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Lelan es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia inglés y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la realiza junto a su hermana que trabaja independientemente, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de administración de empresas y se encuentra en 3 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta conocer los procesos para realizar sus tareas, su espíritu es emprendedor e innovador, conoce como se prepara un presupuesto de gastos o una previsión de ventas, como se construye un organigrama o flujo grama, como se interpreta un balance, como se elabora la planeación y el control de producción, etc., "un buen administrador de empresas es un verdadero líder de su equipo de trabajo, que motiva y estimula a su equipo…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él cuenta con un taller de cerrajería donde trabaja todos los días de la semana en horas del día. La ventaja de sus estudios es que ya se encuentra en los últimos años, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar sus exámenes finales. Su sueño es salir profesional y mejorar su negocio de cerrajería, él desea comprar una computadora portátil para rendir sus exámenes finales. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Lelan solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para rendir sus exámenes finales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lelan is a 23-year-old young man, single, with no children, and is studying for a degree in business administration. 

He is intelligent, enterprising, dedicated, optimistic, happy, cheerful, responsible, and very hard-working. He is a student in a higher education school located in the Pampahasi zone, a place characterized as being on a slope of the city, where the streets are very steep and nearly perpendicular. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Lelan has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a thin physique, his native language is Aymará which he doesn't speak anymore because he studies English and speaks Spanish due to the general culture. He has his life with his sister who works independently. They live in their own house built of brick and cement, with a roof of metal sheeting and a wood floor which has running water, electricity and sewer services. He is studying for a degree in business administration and is in year three of the five that the program lasts. He enjoys helping people, he likes to know the processes to do work, and he has an enterprising and innovative spirit. He knows how to prepare an expense budget or a sales forecast, how to make an organization chart or a flow chart, how to interpret a balance, how to make a plan and production controls, etc. "A good business administrator is a real team leader, who motivates and stimulates the working team..." he says. Alongside his studies, he has a locksmith shop where he works every day of the week during the day. The advantage of his studies is that he is in his last years, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a laptop computer to finish his final exams. His dream is to come out as a professional and improve his locksmith business. He wants to purchase a laptop to do his final exams. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 7 years that he has been in professional studies. 

For these reasons, Lelan asks for a loan to purchase a laptop to do his final exams and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to do his final exams and improve his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She operates a retail shop and has been in business 14 years. 

She will use the loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to have a big business and make enough income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 25 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her general store.

Nenita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 57 years old and has six children. Leonarda is married and has one child who is still in school.

Leonarda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leonarda has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rhodora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Rhodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analiza is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Analiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her business.

Analiza has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Obutowelo parish in Lira District, Northern Uganda. He operates an egg business in the country side. He is aged 31 years, not yet married but takes care of his family, niece and nephew by paying for them school fees, providing basic needs and meeting their family needs.

He started his egg business in 2009 after completing his degree in Information technology and failing to get a job  after completing his university. As a result unemployment and since there is ready market and few competitors in northern Uganda markets, he decided to start this kind of business. A number of businessmen believe that its is not easy to operate an egg business since there are a lot of risks involved but Stephen believes he can run this business.

Stephen who has never borrowed a loan from any bank decided to ask from Ugafode microfinance. As a result of Ugafode Microfinance opening up a branch in Lira, he decided to take a loan in order to boost his business in which he says it will help him a lot to improve his lead time.

The client is likely to succeed in business since his customers are increasing as a result of good quality eggs, quick delivery and constant supplies of eggs thanks to the support he got from Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for sale

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 27 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 5 years

Samina's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. Therefore Samina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.
On this financial assistance Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past eight years and is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Parveen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for the purpose of reselling. Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable Parveen's husband to buy these commodities and help him earn a profitable income to manage his household and business. 
Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo donde vende productos básicos de primera necesidad y junto a su esposo llevan la economía del hogar  y hacen todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Ana  con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual utilizo para encementar la entrada de su vivienda y el corredor de la misma por lo que se encuentra feliz y agradecida,  con el deseo de continuar las mejoras ella solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para poder pintar las paredes de su vivienda y además iniciar la construcción de un cuarto para poder de esta manera separar la tienda a un costado de su casa para esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que la visitan. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito  para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, pintura,  grava y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: At 39 years old, Ana lives in her own home with her husband and children, aged 7 and 5. She has had a store for a long time and she sells staple products. She and her husband support the home and do everything within their reach to give their children the best conditions in life. In order to improve their living conditions, Ana asked for a previous loan, which she used to put in a cement floor at the entrance to her house and in the corridor. They are happy and grateful because of it. In order to continue with the improvements, she is asking for a new loan from FUSAI in order to paint the walls and also start construction on a room so that she can separate the store on the side of the house, thus offering her customers who visit her a better service. For this she is asking for the loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, paint, gravel and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, bricks, paint, and gravel, as well as pay for labor to paint the walls of her home and build a room.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old, married and has one child to provide for. She wants to help her husband with their living and also increase their family income for their daily needs. She loves to cook and that's why she is in the food vending business. She's fond of cooking a variety of delicious foods so she decided to take a loan to purchase additional ingredients for her menu and for the upcoming menu suggested by her husband. She will be able to sell more food in their community. 

Emma's plan for the future is to save more money and to be able to sustain their needs.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the variety of foods that she's going to sell

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel works hard to support her family. Leziel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leziel is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Leziel is aware that by using the solar lamp,she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
Marina, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja como motorista haciendo viajes en su comunidad, tienen tres hijos, 2 viven en Estados Unidos y el otro vive con ella, en su casa también viven algunos de sus nietos. 

Marina, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de cerdos desde que tenía 15 años de edad, pero también se dedico a sembrar maíz, frijol y otros cultivos, ahora su horario en el negocio es de todo el día, pues tiene que alimentarlos y cuidarlos para poder venderlos a buen precio.

Marina, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, pues quiere volver a realizar el negocio del ganado, el préstamo mejorara sus ingresos.

Sus sueños son, tener una vaca para estar obteniendo leche y poder venderla.
texts.en:
Marina, age 64, went to school through the ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a driver making trips in their community. They have three children. Two of them live in the United States, and the other one lives with them. Some grandchildren also live in their house.

Marina has had a business of buying and selling pigs ever since she was 15 years old. However, she also grows corn, beans, and other crops. Now her business schedule is all day. She has to feed and care for them in order to be able to sell them for a good price.

Marina needs the loan to buy a cow. She wishes to return to the livestock business. The loan will improve her earnings. Her dream is to have a cow in order to get milk from it and to be able to sell it.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Abagendana Group

texts.en:
ABAGENDANA a group led by Enock who is 35 years old. The group name means “Walk together” in English. He is single. He is a mechanic and has been doing in a business for the past 8 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more automobile spare parts for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more automobile spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lydia; she is sixty years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 for training in enterprise and financial management which she successfully completed.
She does cattle selling, a business she has been doing for the last thirty years. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training she was able to effectively keep her business records and manage her enterprise efficiently.

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy more cattle for resale to boost her income and hence foster her capability to cater for her family’s food, clothing, and school fees.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: To buy more cattles for resale thus boost income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different sizes of waste bins for resale

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olinda, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuo porque en su escuela solo había hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, su pareja la abandono cuando su hija nació, ahora su niña tiene 5 años de edad y está estudiando en la escuela y ella junto a su hija viven con sus padres.

Olinda, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años de edad, este oficio se lo enseño su papá, pero además trabaja como empleada doméstica, lavando y planchando ropa.- Ella siembra con su papá, maíz y maicillo, el lugar donde siembra está a dos kilómetros de su casa y para llegar lo hace en bicicleta; su día comienza a las 6:00 a.m. y termina a las 12:00 md, cuando lo hace en el campo, pero cuando trabaja de doméstica entra a las 6:00 a.m. al trabajo y sale a las 6:00 p.m.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar maicillo e insumos agrícolas como pesticidas y abono.

Sus sueño son, ver a su hija graduada como ingeniero agronomo, además sueña con construir su propia vivienda y tener un bazar de ropa.
texts.en:
Olinda, 25 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. She didn't continue because her school only went up to the sixth grade. She is a single mother. Her partner left her when her daughter was born. Now her daughter is 5 years old and is going to school and she and her daughter live with her parents.

OIinda has worked in agriculture since she was 10 years old. Her father taught her this work, but in addition she works as a domestic employee, washing and ironing clothing. She plants corn and sorghum with her father, and the place where the plants is two kilometers from her house and she goes there by bicycle. Her day begins at 6:00 am and ends at 12:00 noon when she works in the fields, but when she works as a domestic worker, she goes in to work at 6:00 am and leaves at 6:00 pm.

The loan will be invested to purchase sorghum and agricultural supplies such as pesticides and manure.

Her dream is to see her daughter graduate as an agronomist, in addition she dreams of building her own house and to have a clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum and agricultural supplies such as pesticides and manure.

loans.name: Fidelina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Fidelina, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera de una hija de 15 años de edad, está estudiando noveno grado.

Fidelina, desde que tiene 11 años se dedica al comercio ambulante, ella ha vendido frutas, tamales, atol y maíz, pero desde hace 2 años vende semilla de marañón, una prima de ella le enseño todo el proceso y a ella le gusto ese negocio, ella vende en el mercado que está a 80 kilómetros de su casa y su día comienza a las 4:00 a.m. de la mañana porque a las 5:00 a.m. pasa el bus que la lleva hasta el mercado y regresa a casa a las 5:00 p.m. 

El crédito sera invertido para comprar 6 quintales de semilla de marañón no procesada para vender.

Sus sueños son, ver graduada a su hija de licenciada, construir su casa de ladrillo porque hoy es de tabla y tener un puesto de ropa.
texts.en:
Fidelina, 35 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She is a single mother of a 15-year-old daughter, who is in the ninth grade.

Fidelina has worked as a street vendor since she was 11 years old. She has sold fruits, tamales, atol [a cornflour drink] and corn, but for the past two years she has sold cashew nuts. Her cousin showed her the whole process and she likes this business. She sells at a market which is 80 kilometers from her house and her day begins at 4:00 am because at 5:00 am the bus comes by which brings her to the market, and she comes back home at 5:00 pm.

The loan will be invested in purchasing 6 quintals of unprocessed cashew nuts to sell.

Her dreams are to see her daughter graduate with a degree, to build a brick house because now it is wood, and to have a clothing stall.

loans.use: to purchase 6 quintals of unprocessed cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her sachet and bottled water business

loans.name: Zameeda

texts.en:
Zameeda is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only person responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Zameeda's husband wants to purchase different kinds of goods, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Zameeda has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these goods and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Zameeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to allow her husband to expand his general store business.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 49-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. 

She wants to buy a rickshaw for her son; he wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. 

Therefore, she wants to receive a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family. 

Jamila hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Reyna Olimpia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO,el banco pertenece a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Reyna Olimpia tiene 33 años de edad  es soltera y  tiene 02 hijos, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias, cebollas entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho communal bank. The bank is in Urubamba province and Cusco department.

The borrower, Reyna Olimpia, is 33 years old, single, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with a vegetable business. The borrower is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her due to the determination she puts into her business each day. This is the way the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase carrots, onions, and more.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, onions, and more.

loans.name: Buscando Una Esperanza Group

texts.es: Margot es socia del grupo “Buscando una Esperanza” constituida por 08 personas responsables. Margot de 39 años es casada. Hace más de 10 años que Margot se dedica a la agricultura. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Margot apoyar a sus hijos, pues ha tenido que esforzarse para salir adelante. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su casita. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su sembrillo. El grupo “Buscando una Esperanza” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, pues le permiten su desarrollo de si mismos y de su hogar. Margot es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste de chompa ploma y pantalon negro.
texts.en: Margot is a member of the Buscando una Esperanza group, made up of 8 responsible people. Margot is 39 years old and married. For over 10 years, Margot has worked in agriculture. This work has allowed Margot to support her children, because she has had to work hard to get ahead. Her greatest desire is to finish building her little house. With the end of continuing to improve, she asked for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crops. The Buscando una Esperanza group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible, since it allows them to develop themselves and their households. Margot is the third from the left, wearing a grey sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: José Valentin

texts.es:
Don valentin tiene 56 años de edad y 8 hijos de(30-27-22-21-18-14-12-10), de los cuales los 3 últimos sigen el la escuela. dentro de los sueños y esperanzas del prestatario estas educar profesionalmente a sus 3 ultimo hijos. 
Don valentin tiene 8 años en manejo forestal de la tara que se encuentra dentro de su parcela formando bosques naturales y para poder incrementar su producción se necesita realizar fertilización con guano de isla, todo esto bajo el cuidado del medio ambiente, debido a que don valentin dentro de los próximos meses va a hacer inspeccionado y así poder contar con su certificado orgánico. le gusta el negocio de la tara debido a que es un negocio rentable que no demanda de mucha inversión y la plantación tienen una duración de hasta 100 años.
texts.en:
Valentin is 56 years old and has 8 children, ages 30, 27, 22, 21, 18, 14, 12, and 10, of whom the last 3 are still in school. Among the borrower's hopes and dreams are professionally educating his last three children.

Valentin has been managing tara trees for 8 years, which are located on his plot of land forming natural forests and to be able to increase their production, he needs to fertilize them with island guano. All of this is under the care of the environment, due to Valentin having an inspection in the next few months and in this way he will be able to have his organic certification. He likes his tara business since it is a profitable business which doesn't need a lot of investment and the plantings can last up to 100 years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his tara trees.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La señora Inés vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil soltera y madre hace más de 15 años, tiene 3 hijos dependientes. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con sus hijos, produciendo papa y haba en vaina como los principales productos agrícolas de mayor demanda en el mercado. Los ingresos económicos obtiene a través de la producción y venta de papa y haba en vaina que son también el sustento para su alimentación (auto consumo). La señora Inés requiere un préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 1.5 camiones, semilla de papa (14 cargas), productos agroquímicos y herramientas agrícolas, gastos de tractor agrícola y pago al personal eventual.
Por último, la señora Inés se sintió contenta al tener la posibilidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, incrementará la producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia
texts.en:
Inés lives and works in Colomi. She has been a single mother for over 15 years. She has three dependent children. She devotes herself, together with her children, to producing potatoes and green beans. These are the main agricultural products in great demand at the market. She gets earnings from the potato and green bean production, and they also feed her family (for their own consumption).

Inés needs a loan to buy 1.5 truckloads of organic fertilizer (poultry manure), potato seeds (14 loads), agrochemical products, and agricultural tools. She willl also use the loan to pay for the tractor expenses and to pay temporary workers.

Lastly, Inés feels happy about having the chance to access a loan to meet her needs. With the purchase of agricultural supplies, the production will increase, and she will have greater sales. This will improve her standard of living and her social situation for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, potato seeds, agrochemical products, and agricultural tools in order to improve her sales and the family earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is the responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 25 years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to undertake maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good, and so it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to carry out maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shaheen's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn more profitable income. Shaheen also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Ledema

texts.en:
Ledema is 62 years old and widowed with five children. Ledema works very hard to provide for them.

Ledema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Ledema has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy boxes of bottled water and bag of sachet water for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old, married man from Khan Younis. He works as an employee with a low and unstable income. He also has a rickshaw, which he uses for transporting goods for the local traders. This job provides him with a good income with which he can cover part of the family expenses. 

Ali took a 1,165 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one, and this will enable him to improve his business. Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 47 years old, widowed and has two children.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 65 years old and married. With eight children, Marcela works very hard to provide for them.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Marcela has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Safeena

texts.en:
Safeena is a 39-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 15 years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Safeena's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purpose. Therefore, Safeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband for the above tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Safeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. Yasmeen hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

She dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of various colors and design for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help he husband in fixing his lathe machine and for purchasing  cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

loans.name: Mum

texts.en:
Mum is a 45-year-old homemaker with nine children, who lives in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Her husband is 50 years old and he earns some income from rice farming. Among her 9 children with four of them still in school. Together, the family can earn around USD12 each day. 

Mum would like to improve her family’s finances, therefore she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan, which is her second loan through Kredit MFI, to buy two cows to help with rice farming and for breeding for calves to sell. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to build a new house and support her children in earning high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy two cows for rice farming and for breeding calves to sell

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is 44 years old, married and from Agdash. Parviz has three children. He earns money for his family by bringing up animal husbandry and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. Parviz has been working in this field for five years and his monthly income is 800 AZN. 

He is not happy because his earnings are not enough for his family, because Parviz has a serious problem: His wife is sick. She is a diabetic and her medicines are so expensive, so he needs a loan to buy medicines. He appreciates Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy diabetes medicine for his wife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a 43-year-old, married rice farmer with five children, and she lives in a village in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. For more than 33 years, she has cultivated rice. Her husband is a 53-year-old construction worker, two of her children are working in a factory, one is a construction worker, and the other two children attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $31 per day. 

Chanthou is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a motorcycle, so her children will be able to have better traveling conditions. In the future, Chanthou wants to save money to buy more farmland, build a new proper house and support her youngest children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Sirio

texts.en:
Sirio is 54 years old, married and doesn't have children yet. He owns a rice field and makes it a business of rice production. He needs financial assistance for his farm in order for him to produce more rice to sell in the market. This is the only thing that they have in order for them to live. 

Recently, he took a loan to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for the farm labor. 

Sirio's plan for the future is to save money, and he wants to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ferocyl

texts.en:
Ferocyl is a single mom. She has two children to provide for. In order to support her children in their daily needs, she engaged in a buying and selling business. She goes to the city to buy a variety of dresses and also dry goods to sell in their community. 

She wants to increase her daily income to improve their living conditions; that's why she decided to borrow a loan to buy another variety items and goods to sell.

Ferocyl's plan in the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more assorted dresses and dry goods to sell

loans.name: Ma.fanny

texts.en:
Ma.Fanny is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma.Fanny is 35 years old, and five of her children are still in school.

Ma.Fanny has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma.Fanny requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Ma.Fanny has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are still in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 51 years old and has seven children. Merlinda is married, and four of her children are presently in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Merlinda has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Arcadio Jose

texts.es:
Arcadio es un hombre emprendedor de veinte y cinco años de edad, aprendió al lado de su padre la labor del cuido de ganado, ama la vida en el campo. Desde hace un par de años atrás decidió iniciar su negocio de cuido y venta de ganado. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito logro comprar vacas de raza, las cuales ya han parido, lo que le ha generado un incremento en su negocio. 
En estos momentos, Arcadio, ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva y  MiCrédito, esta vez para que se le otorgue un préstamo para solventar los gastos de un parto de una vaca, pago de veterinario, vacunas, medicamentos, vitaminas, entre otras cosas. En un futuro desea poner un matadero y comenzar a elaborar productos derivados de la leche.
texts.en:
Arcadio, 25, is an enterprising man who learned from his father the practices of raising livestock. He loves the life in the countryside.

A couple of years ago he decided to start his business of breeding and selling livestock. Thanks to a previous Kiva loan through MiCrédito, he was able to buy some cows of breed which have already calved, and this has generated incremental business.

Arcadio has now returned to Kiva and MiCredito asking for a loan to cover the expenses associated with the birth of a calf, including veterinary fees, vaccines, medications, vitamins, and more.

In the future, Arcadio would like to set up a slaughterhouse and to start production of dairy products.

loans.use: to pay the expenses associated with the birth of a calf.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa works hard to support her family. Milagrosa is married with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Milagrosa requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials.

Milagrosa has been in this business for 21 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and rice retailing. Nida is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi is 38 years old and has two children. Mimi is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Mimi is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Mimi requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mimi has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 38 years old married woman with one child. She live in a rural outside of Honiara, the capital city of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling varieties of food and household items and has been doing this for five years.

Marie needs a loan to buy food items such as rice noodle, biscuits, sugar and canned food to assist her run the business.She plan to use her profit to help covers for her family's daily expenses and to build a better home for her family in the future.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: A loan of SBD11100. helps Marie buy rice, sugar, canned food, noodle, biscuits and soup for her general store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years old, married and has five children.

Nida is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Nabonswende  Ziga Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMADO est responsable du groupe NABONSWENDE  ZIGA. Marié, il est père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé a 29 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 03 vont à l'école. Il a 19 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 20 ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 02 sacs d’engrais.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamado is the leader of the group called Nabonswende Ziga. He is married and the father of 10 children. The oldest is 29 and the youngest one year old. Three of them attend school. Hamado is responsible for 19 persons.

Hamado has been doing market gardening for 20 years. He buys his supplies in his village. He wants to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

Hamado wants to use his profits to reinvest in his activity. His hope is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a 15W solar system to light her house after the sunsets and replace the use of candles and kerosene

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has lived in Mukuru Kayaba for most of her life. She moved in this area over fifteen years ago in search of job and business opportunities, it is here that she has also raised her four children. Currently she and her husband have ventured in various businesses: hotel, water vending and three rental units businesses.

To date, Lucy’s family and community experiences poor sanitation: in her area, Marigoini they use makeshift toilets options and public pit latrines. These facilities are not only unsanitary but also inaccessible in the night due to the distance.  

Since Lucy learnt about Fresh Life Toilets, her goal has been to acquire the facility to serve her family and neighborhood. As she says, its availability to her community will be a great incentive towards improved sanitation in the area. Her neighbors will have access to a safe and sanitized toilet option.

She hopes to acquire one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water to sell

loans.name: Nursel

texts.en:
Nursel is married and a mother of four.  In order to be a support for her husband financially, she started to make Turkish ravioli (mantı) and pastas at home.  Nursel has been doing this for 22 years.  With the help of her money she raised her children and they all got married.  With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought flour and meat in bulk.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nursel hanım evli ve 4 çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarını büyütürken eşine destek olmak amacıyla çevresine makarna ve mantı yapamaya başlamış.  Nursel hanım 22 yıldır makarna ve mantı yaparak ek gelir sağlıyor.  Bu işten kazandığı gelir ile çocuklarını büyütmüş ve evlendirmiş.  Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan un ve kıyma aldı.

loans.use: to buy flour and meat for making Manti (Turkish ravioli) at home

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea lives in a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is a 60-year-old widow, with two dependent children. Nowadays, she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income for ten years and it earns her about 32,000KHR per day. Her crops have not grown well, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family’s living. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the first loan cycle for her group and Thea is willing to manage her entire loan portion to buy seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fee to increase productivity of her crop.
