She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to buy a motorbike to drive her to the field and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fee to increase productivity of her crop.

loans.name: Giukhar

texts.en:
Giukhar is 60 years old woman, from village Agtaklia. She lives with her unemployed son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Giukhar was unable to study a professional career. She works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing greens. She always has high quality products, which is sold in the capital's open market. Giukhar works very hard to make the only income for her family's well-being. 

Now she needs financial support to purchase a truck and expand her vegetables trading business with the help of her son. Giukhar and her son will start selling the harvested products through the district and will make their business more profitable. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Giukhar and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase a truck and expand her agricultural trading business further afield

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PORVENIR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma  ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas , la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas . 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belongs to the "Porvenir" lending group. This group is based in the Anta District in the Anta province in Cusco.  Vilma, is one of the group's members. She is single, 39 years old, and has two children. Vilma works selling fruits in different locations. She sells plantains, oranges, and apples, which she has been doing for many years and so far she has done very well.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her produce.  

Vilma is seeking this loan to purchase oranges, plantains, and grapes.  The other members of the group work in businesses that include: selling grains, selling fruits, grocery stores, and restaurants.  The member is very grateful for those who are part of making this dream come true through Kiva, and they are committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase oranges, plantains and grapes.

loans.name: Lagmépengwendé 2 Group

texts.fr: Houa est âgée de 56 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants. Vendeuse depuis plus de 35 ans. Son expérience, le respect de sa clientèle, le prix abordable de sa marchandise sont des atout qui font marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 2 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile,  et 10 sacs de maïs. L’utilité c’est d’approvisionner sa boutique en quantité suffisante pour revendre et avoir un bénéfice. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 05 fois a ACFIME et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Houa is 56 years old, a widowed mother of five children. She has been engaged in small-scale retailing for more than 35 years. Her experience, the respect of her clientele, and the affordable prices of her merchandise are trump cards that keep her business running.

Houa wants the loan to buy two sacks of rice, two containers of oil, and 10 sacks of maize. The usefulness of the loan is to allow her to stock her shop with a sufficient quantity to resell and have a profit.

Houa has already received a loan five times from ACFIME and has reimbursed on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, two containers of oil, and 10 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Finess 15 Group

texts.fr: Sophie est âgée de 29 ans, célibataire mère d’un enfant. Elle a une expérience de plus de 7 ans dans la coiffure et la vente des mèches. Son expérience, son respect de la clientèle et le bon prix de sa marchandise par rapport aux autres sont pour elle un atout pour réussir son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 250 mèches afin de revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour subvenir au besoin de son enfant. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois à ACFIME et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Sophie is 29 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She has more than seven years' experience in hair-styling and the sale of hair extensions. Her experience, her respect for her clientele, and the reasonable cost of her merchandise compared to the competition are a trump card for her in succeeding in her business.

Sophie wants the loan to buy 250 hair extensions for resale so as to have profits to support her child. She has already received three loans from ACFIME and has reimbursed them on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy 250 hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Joel Abdiel

texts.es: Don Joel se dedica a la ganadería, principalmente a la producción de leche. Con un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100) podrá comprar dos novillas. Con esta inversión pretende incrementar su producción, así como sus ventas.
texts.en: Joel works raising cattle, primarily for milk production. With this loan of $2,100, he will be able to purchase two heifers. This investment will allow him to increase his production as well as his sales.

loans.use: purchase heifers to milk.

loans.name: Luis Omar

texts.es:
Luis, de 26 años de edad, está soltero, vive junto a sus padres, estudio hasta bachillerato, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a sus padres para realizar las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas.

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en las parcelas que alquilan durante la mañana y en la tarde cuida las vacas que posee.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes, porque las necesita para poder arar la tierra y obtener la cosecha de donde siembra. 

Luis, sueña con comprar una parcela, para poder sembrar y tener sus animales.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old, single, lives with his parents, and has a high school education. He wakes up at 5:00am with his parents to work the farm and care for their cattle.  In the morning, Luis works farming the plots of land that they rent, and in the afternoons he takes care of their cows.  

Luis is seeking a loan to purchase a pair of oxen that he needs to plow the soil and harvest his crops.  Luis dreams of purchasing a plot of land where he can plant crops and house his animals.

loans.use: purchase a pair fo oxen

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Paula Emilia  se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia quiere salir adelante por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Paula Emilia belongs to the "Virgencita del Carmen de Huycho" lending group. The group is based in Huayllabamba, in the Urubamba province of Cusco.  Paula Emilia works selling vegetables. She hopes to get ahead in life through this business, and so far she has done very well. Her dream is to expand her business.  She is seeking a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, and squash. She is very happy to receive this loan and she is committed to make the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase tomatoes, onions, and squash.

loans.name: Dúo La Providencia Group

texts.es:
DUO LA PROVIDENCIA.
Es conformado por  Blanca de 35 años de edad, es originaria del municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, ella ha ejercido la habilidad de tejido de servilletas, y bordado en blusas de señoras a mano, actividad que aprendieron desde muy pequeñas,  y con el cual es conocida en el lugar cuando  las clientas requieren de alguna prenda o tejido típico del municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez. Solicitan de capital para comprar hilos y lana en varios colore para elaborar sus tejidos, ya que con la ayuda de kiva ella sueña con agrandar mas su negocio y estar mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, 35 years old, is a member of the "Duo La Providencia" lending group. Blanca is a native of San Juan Sacatepéquez. She works weaving napkins and sewing blouses by hand, trades that she learned form a very young age. She is now very well known for it in her town, and she is sought by customers when they need a new piece of clothing or a traditional item from the region.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase threads and wool in various colors to make her products. She hopes to be able to expand her business and improve her living conditions with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: purchase materials to make traditional fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Cristina Jeaneth

texts.es:
Cristina, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad, su pareja los abandono desde hace 10 años.

Cristina, desde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de semilla de marañón, la necesidad la llevo a dedicarse a este negocio cuando su pareja la abandono, eso la motivo para seguir adelante y hoy agradece a Dios porque su hija está estudiando bachillerato y gracias al negocio le puede dar lo necesario para que estudie; ella todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. porque a las 5:00 a.m. Ella compra la semilla de marañón ya procesada y luego ella la embolsa para luego venderla, ella viaja todos los días en bus 80 kilómetros y trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m. y regresa a las 5:00 p.m.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar semilla sin procesar para vender, de donde espera obtener mejor ganancias.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y colocar un negocio de ropa, para no tener que viajar tanto.
texts.en: Cristina is 41 years old. She studied up to third grade. She is a single mother of two children, ages 15 and 19. Her partner abandoned them 10 years ago. For 10 years, Cristina has worked selling cashew seeds. Necessity made her work in this business when her partner abandoned her. That motivated her to keep on working; and today she thanks God because her daughter is studying high school and thanks to her business, she can give her all that is needed for her education. Every day, she gets up at 4:00 a.m. because at 5:00 a.m. she buys the already processed cashew seeds. Later, she bags them for sale. She travels 80 kilometers by bus every day, and she works since 5:00 a.m. and returns at 5:00 p.m. She will use the loan to buy unprocessed seed to sell, from where she hopes to get better earnings. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to start a clothing business so she does not have to travel so much.

loans.use: to buy unprocessed seeds to sell.

loans.name: Cerro San Juan Group

texts.es: Román, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de Intibucá con su familia. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijol y papa, el cual es su fuente de ingresos para la familia. Esta producción es vendida en el mercado local del municipio. Román ha decidido solicitar un prestamo en forma grupal para invertir en la compra de 8 quintales de abono, fungicidas e insecticida para dar asistencia y siembra de papa, maíz y frijol, con el objetivo es mejorar el rendimiento de sus cosechas. Su meta es seguir trabajando para obtener ingresos y darles educación a sus hijos y brindar mejor vida a su familia. El grupo se llama Cerro San Juan, integrado por 4 miembros que también se dedican al cultivo de papas y granos básicos. los miembros  se conocen  ya que viven en la misma comunidad y han decidido solicitar un préstamo total por 40,000 Lempiras para comprar abono, fungicidas e insecticidas para el cultivo de papa y granos básicos. En la foto están de pie Román a la izquierda y Doroteo a la derecha; y sentados está Mateo y Jose a la derecha.
texts.en: Román is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children and lives in the municipality of Intibuca with his family. For the past 10 years, he has worked in agriculture growing corn, beans, and potatoes, which is his source of income for the family. He sells his products at the local market in the municipality. Roman decided to ask for a loan as a group to purchase 8 quintals of manure, fungicides, and insecticides to maintain and grow potatoes, corn and beans, to improve the yield of his crops. His goal is to continue working to generate income and give an education to his children and a better life to his family. The group's name is Cerro San Juan, formed by 4 members who also work growing potatoes and basic grains. All the members met and  live in the same community and have decided to ask for a loan totalling 40,000 Lempiras to buy manure, fungicides, and insecticides to grow potatoes and basic grains. In the picture, we can see standing,  Roman on the left, and Doroteo on the right; and sitting, Mateo and Jose on the right.

loans.use: To purchase 8 quintals of manure, fungicides and insecticides to maintain and plant potatoes, corn and beans.

loans.name: Miguel Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Miguel Alfredo se dedica al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza casas y edificios, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de maestro de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO” communal bank which is located in the district of Huayllabamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and Cusco department..

The member Miguel Alfredo works in his business as a master builder. He makes houses and buildings. His dream is to expand his business as a master builder. He is requesting a loan to buy construction material like wood and tools.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of his installments..

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood and tools.

loans.name: Dúo La Moderna Group

texts.es: La señora Gladys Amanda tiene una farmacia ubicada en los planes villa nueva ella quiere poder comprar más medicina y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes toda clase de medicina ella dice que le da pena no poder ofrecer todas las medicinas necesarias a sus clientes pero con la ayuda de fape ella podra comprar una estanteria y surtir los medicamentos en su farmacia ella sueña poder dejar de alquilar y tener su local propio ella dice que lo podra lograr con la ayuda de fape kiva  y poco a poco mejorar sus finanzas para mejoras de su familia.
texts.en: Gladys Amanda has a pharmacy located in the Villa Nueva area. She wants to buy more medicines to offer her clients a full assortment of medicines. She is sad that she does not have enough medicines needed by her clients, but with the help of FAPE she will be able to buy shelving and supply the medicines in her pharmacy. She dreams of not renting anymore and of having her own store. She says that she will be able to to do it with the help of FAPE and Kiva, and little by little her finances will improve which will help her family improve.

loans.use: To purchase medicines to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Angelica se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. It is located in the district of Lamay, belonging to the province of Calca and Cusco department.

The member Angelica works in her handicraft business. She sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells different kinds of fabrics. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She has run this business for 8 years and things are going very well. Her dream is to expand her business selling fabric and looms. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, sweaters and looms.

She is happy with the loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is 54 years old and married with four children.  

Alejandrina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alejandrina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alejandrina has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alejandrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tehzeem

texts.en:
Tehzeem is 37 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years.

Tehzeem's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, lace needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Tehzeem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.
On this financial assistance Tehzeem is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Dilan

texts.en:
Dilan is 24 years old end she has started business since she was very young.  With her mother's support she opened a store selling oversized clothes and she took the whole responsibility of  her store.  With the help of the loan from Maya she bought clothing in bulk for her store.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Dilan hanım 24 yaşında ve genç yaşta ticarete atılmış.  Annesinin desteği ile büyük beden kadın kıyafetleri sattığı bir mağaza açmış ve bütün sorumluluğu kendi yüklenmiş.  Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan ürün aldı.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her store, which offers larger sizes for women

loans.name: Rosmery Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica al trabajo como emfermera,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios en este trabajo y quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Virgencita Del Carmen De Huycho". The bank is located in the district of Huayllabamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

She makes a living working as a nurse. She works from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm. The member has been performing this work for many years, and she wishes to move her family forward.

The member is requesting a loan to buy a television for her home. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, etc. and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Celerina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Celerina has been in this business for 30 years. Celerina earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Celerina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her repair shop  business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma, de 23 años de edad, estudio Técnico en Enfermería, está soltera, actualmente se dedica a vender pupusas y vive con sus padres.

Norma, desde hace un año se dedica a vender pupusas junto a su madre, porque cuando salio de estudiar, no encontró trabajo, por eso decidió dedicarse a este negocio de Lunes a Sábado.

Norma, por primera vez está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para el negocio, porque tienen bastantes clientes y necesitan darles un buen servicio, de esa forma lograra mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener más ingresos. 

El sueño de Norma, es conseguir trabajo como enfermera, pero mientras tanto desea seguir trabajando con su madre en el negocio.
texts.en:
Norma, age 23, studied to become a nursing assistant, is single and she currently works selling pupusas (thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken or beans) and lives with her parents. 

For a year she has been selling pupusas along with her mother because she couldn’t find a job when she finished her studies. That is why she decided to work in this business from Monday to Saturday. 

Norma is requesting for the first time a loan to buy chairs and table for her business. She has a lot of customers and needs to give them a good service in order to obtain more incomes and improve her quality of life.

Norma’s dream is to get a job as a nurse, but meanwhile she wants to keep working in her business along with her mother.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is 41 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of 7 children. Her husband is electrician and he has been running his electric store for past 35 years.
Imtiaz's husband has to purchase electric merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes and other electric devices but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase these merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also him her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Imtiaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's electrical business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sachet and bottled water for resale

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Nak is a 33-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care, and she resides in the Kandal Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2011. Her husband is a 35-year-old security guard. Nak and her husband can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Nak would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows for breeding calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Nak is going to save money to build a proper house and support her children's studies through high school.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding calves to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Paulina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia quiere salir adelante por medio de este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina belongs to the "El Truinfo" communal bank. The bank is located in the Lamay district, which belongs to the Calca province and the department of Cusco.

Paulina has earned a living selling vegetables. She wants to get ahead by way of this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the vegetable selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, onions and squash.

Paulina is happy about the loan, and is committed to making the required payments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and squash.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products. Rosalinda has been in this business for 15 years, and she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, de 41 años de edad, no estudio debido a que en la zona donde vivían no habían escuelas cerca y sus padres a ella y sus hermanos solo los pusieron a trabajar, está acompañada, su pareja es jornalero y agricultor, tienen cuatro hijos y todos son mayores de edad.

Santos, desde niña sus padres le enseñaron a elaborar hamacas de hilo, cuando se acompaño tuvo que apoyar a su pareja en la agricultura, ella le ha enseñado a sus hijos a hacer hamacas también y ahora ellos son quienes le apoyan cuando tiene encargos y el día domingo van a la plaza de la ciudad a venderlas a buen precio.

Santos, solicita el préstamo para comprar hilos y otros materiales que necesita para la elaboración de hamacas, porque en el mes tienen que hacer bastantes y no tienen materiales suficientes para terminarlas.

El sueño de Santos, es que cada día mejoren sus ingresos y que siempre sus hijos les apoyen para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old. She never studied as there were no schools nearby in the area where she lived and her parents put her and her siblings to work. She is in a relationship, her partner works as day labor and is a farmer. They have four children all of them adults.

Santos parents taught her to make hammocks since she was a child. When she entered her relationship she had to help her spouse with the farming. She has taught her children to make hammocks too and now they help her when she has orders. On Sundays they go to the plaza of the city to sell them at a good price.

Santos is requesting the loan to buy thread and other materials that she needs to make the hammocks as in the coming month she has to make quite a number and she doesn't have enough material to complete them.

Santos' dream is to increase her income every day and always be able to support her children to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy thread and other materials that she needs to make hammocks.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 25 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the South Rift area of Kenya. He makes a living by producing dairy products, raising poultry and crop farming.  

Benard is seeking a loan to start commercially farming poultry. The form of poultry farming that he is doing currently is not productive and sustainable. With this loan, however, he plans to buy over 30 heads of poultry. This loan investment into his business will ensure that the poultry products produced are high above the family consumption level, meaning that the revenue from the sale of poultry products will be sufficient to sustain the venture and generate income. 

Income from the poultry farm will be used by Benard to repay the loan and expand the business. In the long run, his family's livelihood will be much improved.

loans.use: to buy over 30 heads of poultry.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Nestor learned Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Nestor feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used fo his business. 

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer for the next cropping season. Nestor wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is raising hogs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has three children.

Jacinta wants to improve her hogs sustenance and growth, that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and rice bran for their maintenance.

Though she only generate an unstable income, she still continues to manage her hog raising business for good profits.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran to maintain her hogs.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business. Bernadith earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Bernadith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 33-year-old married lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business selling fresh foods and is a salary earner too. 

Irene is faced with the challenge of the seasonality of products that limit expansion of her business. However, she is working very hard to make sure she builds a permanent house for her family. Irene has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and oranges to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a hardworking married lady with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda.

She is a retailer selling charcoal and fresh foods at the same time to add more to her income. She is faced with hardships of defaulters and this limits growth of her profits. Besides that, she is working very hard to make sure she buys land where she can to build a permanent home for her family .

Prossy is in need of a loan to buy soda, salt and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, salt and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking 40 year old married woman with 5 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in cattle fattening and also sells milk to get additional income. She plans to expand and modernize her farm but inadequate capital has hindered her dreams.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 45-year-old, hardworking, married woman with 10 children. She lives in Kamwenge,Uganda, where 7 of her children attend school. She operates a ladies beauty salon which she supplements with coffee farming in order to get income and sustain her family. Her wish is to expand her business and educate her children but she is limited by inadequate capital.

She is requesting for a loan to buy a hand drier, rollers, and hair conditioners to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy a hand drier, rollers, and hair conditioners to use in her salon.

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas is a hard-working widow living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more chickens to sell. She deals in poultry as her main source of income, though she has other side businesses, such as farming and rentals, where she earns extra income. She started this business to sustain herself and have a better standard of living. She faces challenges of high prices of chicken feed and chicken diseases that affect her birds and sometimes kill them. She has a vision of owning a big, modern poultry farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her chicken.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is a married mother of an only son, who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Since 1998, she has run a business selling rice, palm sugar and prahok (prahok is salty fish kept in the jar for about a month or longer and needs to be steamed to have with fresh vegetables). Her husband is 47 years old and works as a worker in road construction. Her son is 18 years old and works as a carpenter.

Hoeun has decided to take out a loan because she is lacking the finances to buy rice, palm sugar and prahok to sell. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and earn more income.

In the future, she is going to buy a motorcycle for her son for commuting to work. She also hopes that her son will pass his exam to work in Korea.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm sugar and prahok (salt fish) to sell.

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en:
Zahide is 48 year old, married and she has 2 kids. For many years Zahide has been working in farming, with her main crop being lemons. The work is going very well, as she has many years' experience. She is always worried about giving her customers the highest quality products. 

But she has a problem with water. Every time she has to get water from neighbor. For this reason she is asking for a loan 835 azn, so that she can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand her  lemon crops.

Zahide is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support . With that she will be able to buy a water pump

loans.use: to buy a water pump for her lemon trees

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 67 years old. He is married and they have one child. He sells cereals and has been in business for three years. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy more cereals for sells.  

He will use profits from the expanded business to repair his house. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a major supplier of cereals in the county.

loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Evangelina  se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank “EL TRIUNFO”. The bank is located in the district of Lamay, province of  Calca, department of Cusco.

The partner Evangelina works in the business of crafts; the partner sells cloths, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells different types of cloths and works from 8.00 am to 7:00 pm. The partner has already been in this business for 8 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the business of sales of cloths and looms. The partner is requesting a loan to buy cloths, sweaters and looms. 

The partner is happy for having the loan and is committed to meeting her fee payments.

loans.use: to buy cloths, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman with eight children. Estela is 38 years old and seven of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Estela has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Estela requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evella works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Evella is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, rice, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Evella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, vegetables, rice, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Naret is 43 years old and lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is the mother of a small child. Currently, she farms rice as the main source of her family’s income. She sometimes works as a construction worker for a fee to earn additional income. She has been involved in her job for twenty-five years. 

Naret's business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 4,000 KHR each day after paying her family's expenses. The price of rice is decreasing in the market, which is a problem for her business and is what made her decide to apply for her first Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will use her entire loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide to support her farmland and to boost her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain high yields to raise her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide to support her farmland and to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kajall Mahila Mandal 3 Group

texts.en:
Jyotsanaben is the first lady from the right in the group picture. She is a 36-year-old married woman with two teenage children. She runs her own bagasara (bangles, bindis, hair bands, etc.) business in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.

The earnings from her business contribute 5,000 INR to her monthly household income of 12,000 INR. With monthly expenses of 9,000 INR, she can barely save 3,000 INR. She believes that if she could expand her business by selling more bangles, earrings, rings, artificial jewelry, etc., she will be able to add another 2,000 INR to her monthly household income. To expand her business, she is seeking a loan of 20,000 INR. Her increased income would help her keep up with rising expenses.

Gitaben, Daliben, Rubina and Manisha (the rest of the women in the picture) are each in need of a loan as well. Daliben and Manisha hope to expand their cloth business. Rubina needs the loan to purchase a sewing machine, and Gitaben wants to expand her bagasara business, just like Jyotsanaben. Together, the group seeks a loan of 100,000 INR. Your loan will help the individual borrowers expand their businesses. They are grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase earrings, bangles, etc to expand her bagasara (costume jewelery) business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a thirty five year old single woman with three children living in Masindi-Uganda. She sells second hand clothes and also does farming. She started this business in order to get basic needs of life. She hopes to build a permanent house for her self and provide for her children as a single loving parent.
She is requesting for a loan to buy second hand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Tukoragane Nyabakande  Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of four children. She is a married, hardworking lady living in Hoima, Uganda. Her business is produce buying and selling alongside farming, mainly growing tobacco for additional income. She ventured into her business to get an income to support her family.

Josephine is a hardworking woman who loves to see herself having a sustainable source of income, only to be challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. Josephine is asking for a loan to buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.

Adelina, trabaja en la alcaldía de su municipio desde hace 2 años, anteriormente elaboraba productos de artesanía de barro y aún la sigue realizando porque tiene más de 14 años de experiencia con este conocimiento que adquirió de su madre; ella trabaja de 7:30 a 4:30 en la alcaldía municipal y los fines de semana trabaja los productos de artesanía.

Adelina, necesita el crédito para comprar material de barro, para la elaboración de productos de artesanía. 

Adelina, sueña con darle el estudio a sus hijos, para que puedan formarse académicamente y seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelina is 32 years old and finished her bachelor's degree. She has a partner and 2 children, who are 13 and 11 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children.

Adelina works in the mayor's office of her municipality for 2 years. Previously, she made handicraft products out of clay and she still continues because she has more than 14 years of experience with this skill that she learned from her mother. She works from 7:30 to 4:30 in the mayor's office and during the weekends she works on the handicraft products.

Adelina needs a loan to buy clay material to make handicraft products.

Adelina dreams about giving an education to her children so that they can develop academically and continuing to work so that she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clay material to make handicraft products.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 53 years old, married, and has a child. Visitacion manages a retail business for income. She has been selling different grocery items for income.

She wants to improve her retail business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep selling good products and provide friendly services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old. She is married and they have two children. She sells vegetables and has been in business for five years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy stock of tomatoes, cabbages, Kales and carrots for sale. She will use profits from the expanded business to feed her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big grocery.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 31 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a hotel business for the past one year, and the business is doing well.

She will be using the loan to purchase hotel furniture, and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a bigger hotel and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase hotel furniture to earn income to help her pay school fees.

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas de 24 y 16 años de edad, gracias a sus esfuerzo su hija mayor logro graduarse de la universidad y la menor estudia bachillerato, ella estudio hasta sexto grado, porque era la mayor de sus hermanos y tenia que apoyar a sus padres para salir adelante, con su esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda.

Alicia, desde muy pequeña se dedico a los oficios domésticos, luego se caso y se separo de su esposo porque él emigro hacia los Estados Unidos, ella siguió luchando y ahora en día tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, en un local pequeño que está alquilando en el centro de su comunidad; antes había iniciado una venta de lácteos pero por razones de salud, tuvo que dejar de vender.- Ahora, trabaja desde las cinco de la mañana, porque tiene que ir al molino a moler el maíz y luego vende hasta la 1:00 de la tarde.- Los fines de semana se dedica a limpiar casas a diferentes personas y a veces lo hace con el apoyo de sus hijas.

Alicia, solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, cal y otros productos para hacer tortillas, gracias a sus ahorros ya compro una plancha.- Con este crédito seguirá con su negocio, lo que le permitirá prosperar y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.

El sueño de Alicia es, seguir trabajando en su venta de tortillas, así como aumentar la producción para ganar más.- Ademas,  en el futuro desea ir mejorando su vivienda, para vivir más dignamente.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and a single mother with two children who are 24 and 16 years old. Thanks to her hard work, her oldest daughter graduated from University and her youngest is studying for a High School Diploma. She herself has only studied up to sixth grade because, being the eldest amongst her siblings, she had to help her parents get by.  Through her hard work she has managed to build a house.  

Alicia, since she was young, has earned a living from domestic roles. She married later but separated from her husband because he emigrated to the United States.  She continued to strive and now she has a tortilla selling business based in a small shop she is renting in the centre of her community. She had previously started a business selling dairy products but due to health issues she had to give it up. 

She now works from five in the morning, because she has to go to the mill to grind corn, and finishes at 1pm. At the weekends she earns a living cleaning the homes of different people and she sometimes does this with the help of her daughters. 

Alicia is applying for a loan in order to buy corn, lime and other products to make tortillas.  Thanks to her savings she has already bought a griddle. With this loan she'll be able to maintain her business, prosper and give her daughters a better quality of life.

Alicia's dream is to continue working in her tortilla selling business and be able to increase it's production in order to earn more income. Also, in the future she hopes to continue improving her home in order to live with more dignity.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and other products to make tortillas.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 62 years old. He is married and they have three children.He does livestock trade selling cattle and goats. He has been in business for two years. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy goats for sale. He will use profits from the expanded business to do home repairs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a major distributor.

loans.use: buy goats for sale

loans.name: Ndokanio Kathuluni Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand (wearing a purple skirt) in the photo is Penninah, 27 years old with two dependents. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She operates a beauty salon. She is borrowing a loan to buy beauty products to boost income from her salon business. This will enable her to buy food and pay school fees for her dependents.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, and hence boost income from her salon business to buy food and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samuni Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Susan; a member Samuni Women Group. She is seventy two years old, married and a mother of eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

She does vegetables farming in a green house as her main business. She is borrowing Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to boost vegetable farming business that will consequently increase her income. This will assist her to cater for the family expenses such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for her two grand children. 

Susan is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to boost vegetable farming business for increased income to pay family expenses

loans.name: Daysy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Daysi, es una mujer  de cuarenta y siete años de edad, muy trabajadora, se ha abierto paso en la vida, luchando  por sí sola, es madre de tres hijos varones. Desde los catorce años su madre le enseño el quehacer del hogar, a los dieciocho empezó a laborar como doméstica, con el pasar de los años se encontró con un mejor trabajo en una fábrica de tabaco, desde entonces labora en el área de producción de la fábrica. 
Esta valiente mujer ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento para cambiar su letrina por un servicio higiénico, conectado a las tuberías de su ciudad, esto le permitirá mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida, además de preservar la salud de ella y sus seres queridos, también se dejara de contaminar el suelo. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando con financiamientos para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y crear un negocio.
texts.en:
Daysy is a 47-year-old woman. She is a hard worker and has made her own path in life by striving for herself. She is the mother of three boys. When she was 14 years old, her mother taught her how to do household tasks, and at 18 she began working as a domestic worker. As the years passed, she found a better job at a tobacco factory. Since then, she works in the production area of the factory.

This brave woman has sought out Kiva and MiCrédito to receive a loan to change her latrine for toilet facilities by connecting to the city's sewage system. This will allow her to noticeably improve her quality of life, in addition to preserving her health and that of her loved ones. This will also stop soil contamination. In the future, she hopes to continue working with loans to improve the infrastructure of her home and to create a business.

loans.use: to change her latrine for toilet facilities

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
Voeurn and her husband sell house wood material for a living. They have five children. Besides selling wood, Voeurn's husband does fishing during peak season, while Voeurn has to stand by in the shop.

Voeurn's shop needs energy to operate during the nighttime; however, her current energy is not reliable and wastes a lot of money. During the busy season, while her husband has to do fishing every day, she has to take time and energy to go charge the car battery every 3 or 4 days. After seeing the difficulty of using a car battery, Voeurn decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system.

She believes the solar home system can help her save money and time. She also can live in comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Chhnok Tru Village,Chhnok Tru Commune, Boribo Dist

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su familia en el distrito de Lagunas, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.Es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercia mayormente.

Clarisa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, desde hace más de 3 años, siendo muy conocida por zona. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para negocio, lo cual le incrementará sus ventas lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her family in the district of Lagunas, in the Chiclayo Province, within the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.  It is a community that works primarily in agriculture and business.

She has worked selling groceries for the past three 3 years, and is well known in the area.  She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, which will help her to increase her sales, which will allow her to increase her income and earnings, thus improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Yakene Group

texts.fr: YAMONO est  la dame qui tient la corde  du bélier sur la photo. Elle est malienne  âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère  de 6 enfants ; âgées de 4 à 17ans dont  deux (2)  scolarisés ; son mari est un cultivateur. YAMONO  fait  l’élevage d’ovin, elle achète des moutons,  les élever  et les revendre. Elle  a 6 ans activités. YAMONO fait recourt au prêt du RMCR  afin d’augmenter   son chiffre d’affaire et s’acheter beaucoup de moutons. Elle fait ses achats et ses ventes  dans les foires  de  sa localité, avec  son  profit elle parvient  à aider  sa famille en prenant en charge les  frais de scolarité, santés, et de condiments.  Dans les jour  à venir  ,YAMONO  aimerait  avoir un prêt  plus élevé  et d’acheter plus  de moutons  afin d’avoir beaucoup  de profit , son rêve est  acheter  une  moto  ou une charrette  pour  la famille.
texts.en:
Yamono is the one holding the  sheep's cord in the photo. She is from Mali, 30 years old, married and the mother of six children ranging from 4 to 17 years of age, two of whom are in school. Yamono raises sheep: she buys sheep, feeds them and later resells. She has six years of experience

Yamono has reached out to RMCR for a loan in order to increase her working capital and buy many sheep. She buys and sells on market days in her area. Thanks to her revenues, she manages to help her family by covering the costs of schooling, healthcare and food. In the future, Yamono would like to have a larger loan in order to buy more sheep and earn more revenues.  Her dream is to buy a motor bike or a cart for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Zayd

texts.en:
Zayd is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Zayd has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: Zayd learned to design and craft jewelry by coincidence. "I wanted to create a gift for my wife's birthday, so I made a pair of earrings and she loved them! Many of her friends asked if I could make some for them, and that's how it all got started!" "I thank all of you who have supported me with this loan. I would like to build up my inventory and also prepare new designs." Use the link below to view Zayd's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5371

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 42-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working as a teacher for twenty years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 
Samaher is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying hard to provide her only child with a descent life. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's tutorial sessions fees which will help him improve his grades at school. This loan is very important to Samaher, for she believes that education is the only way to guarantee her child's life. She hopes to stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her child's tutorial sessions fees to improve his grades at school

loans.name: Rusbel

texts.es:
El socio Rusbel  se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales, el socio vende maiz,cacao y quinua, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cacao, maíz y quinua.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member Rusbel has a business selling grains. He sells corn, cacao, and quinoa, working from 8:00am to 5:00pm. He has been doing this work for 4 years now, and it's been going well for him. Rusbel's dream is to have a store where he can sell his grains. He is requesting the loan to purchase cacao, corn, and quinoa. Rusbel is happy to have the loan, and promises to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to purchase cacao, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Pacita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Pacita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvira is 59 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Elvira has a buy and sell oyster business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an oyster to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oysters to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano, María Elena, comienza a lavar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes para luego ponerlos en bolsa, ella es vendedora ambulante de chiltoma, cebolla, tomates, entre otros vegetales y frutas, tiene cuarenta y un años siendo comerciante. Gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante, uno de ellos esta pronto a terminar la universidad. 
Lastimosamente, los productos han subido de precio, cada vez se le dificulta abastecerse, por eso ella ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo, que le permita comprar vegetales y frutas y asi surtirse lo necesario para cubrir la demanda de los clientes. En un futuro desea poner una tienda, en la cual pueda ofertar sus productos y otros, como por ejemplo carnes.
texts.en:
Starting very early in the morning, María Elena starts to wash and then bag the products she offers to her customers. She is a traveling merchant of chiltoma, onions, tomatoes, among other vegetables and fruits. She has been a merchant for forty-one years. Thanks to her hard work, she has succeeded in getting her children ahead. One of them is about to finish university.

Sadly, the products have been rising in price, and every time it is more difficult to stock up. For this reason, she is appealing to Kiva and MiCrédito, so that they will grant her a loan, which will allow her to buy vegetables and fruits and stock what's necessary to meet customer demand.  

In the future, she wants to have a store, in which she can offer her products and others like meats, for example.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Fatima Norma

texts.es:
El sueño de Fátima es llegar a tener una casa digna, donde ella y su familia puedan vivir sin mayor riesgo ni problemas. Por esta razón, esta madre de 41 años de edad, trabaja desde muy temprana edad para completar con sus sueños, en especial el de su propia casa. Desde hace más de dos años es rolera en una fábrica de puros, lo que le ha ayudado a ahorrar para salir adelante. 
Una de las cosa que hacían falta en la casa de Fátima, era el servicio higiénico, pues no contaba con aguas negras ni con el dinero completo. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar ducha, inodoro, azulejos, lavamanos, entre otros materiales de construcción para hacer su baño en la casa soñada. En sus planes también esta terminar por completo la construcción de su hogar y seguir trabajando con esa dedicación que es caracterizada.
texts.en:
Fátima's dream is to have a suitable home, where she and her family could live without major problems or risks.  For this reason, this 41-year-old mother has been working from a very early age to achieve her dreams, especially of her own home.  For more than two years she has worked as a roller in a cigar factory, which has helped her save in order to get ahead.

One of the things that Fátima's house lacks is a hygienic restroom, since she does not have a sewer line, nor all the money to install it.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a shower, toilet, tiles, sink, and other construction materials to build her bathroom in the home she dreamed of.  Also in her plans are to complete construction on her home and continue working with her characteristic dedication.

loans.use: to buy a shower, toilet, tiles, sink, and other materials.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Esterlina works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Esterlina is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop business.

Esterlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for vulcanizing

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Purita works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cafeteria and tailoring businesses. Purita is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of seasonings, spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 43 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of seasonings, spices and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus is 44 years old, is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Arus and her husband work as agricultural day laborers. They have their own farm where they keep a cow, calves, 75 hens. 
The family also owns a beautiful orchard where different fruit trees are grown (apricot, peach, cherry, plum, pomegranite, walnut, pear and apple). 
Arus and her husband work hard to sell the gathered harvest in local market and gather income for family. 

Arus has applied for this loan to purchase three cows, forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer for land cultivation.
This is her second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Arus faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Arus has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Arus's greatest goal is for her business to become increasingly profitable in order to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for three cows, forage for feeding the livestock, fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Joyce, twenty seven years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
Joyce has been able to use the skills she got from the training offered by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to run and manage her maize farming business which is her main economic activity.
  
She is taking a loan to buy farm inputs such as top dressing fertilizers which will help her get high yields. Her income will therefore increase and will be able to manage her family’s needs such as food, clothing and shelter.

She is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer that will help improve on crop yield thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Don Timoteo se dedica a la cría de ganado para su posterior venta. Él solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000) con el cual comprará cuatro terneros para aumentar el número de animales en su finca y de esta manera incrementar el nivel de ventas y mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Don Timoteo makes a living raising cattle for resale. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars with which he will buy four calves to increase the number of animals on his farm. In this way he can increase the level of sales and improve the profitability of his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a 44-year-old married father of three children. He is acquiring this loan to pay for his children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. 

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Fahed hopes to stay capable of providing his children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a clothing business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to purchase clothes and hopes this will help him build a house.

His hopes and dreams for the future are expand the business and pay school fees successfully.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale with profits to help him build a house

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angela is 35 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Angela has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angela has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Tobias, sixty two years old, married and blessed with six children.He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in  2014.
Tobias operates a retail kiosk, where he sells house hold goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training (HiH EA) which has enabled him acquire skills on enterprise and financial management. 

He is taking a Kiva loan to expand his business by adding more stock. This will attract more customers hence more income through which he will educate his children, provide medical care and other family needs.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of flour, sugar and cooking fat that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Catalinda

texts.en: Catalinda is 41 years old, married and had two children. She is raising hogs to sell because she needs to provide income for her family. She wanted to keep providing good nutrition to hogs that is why she is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and rice bran for hogs sustenance. This will help maintain healthy growth of her hogs and able to sell them at higher cost someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for hogs sustenance

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, John suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, John will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, John now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is a 41 years old man. He is married and they have three children.  He does maize farming and has been in the business for four years. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he intends to use the loan to purchase fertilizer as well as pay school fees for his children. 

He will use the profit from his business to educate his children as well as service the loan. 

His hopes and dreams for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to use the loan to purchase fertilizer as well as pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 32 years old, and  married with 2 children.  He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training and especially enterprise development. 

Erick is involved in fruits selling business. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more fruits hence add stock and earn more income. This will enable him pay school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for resale hence earn more income to enable him pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es:
Desde que estaba en el colegio, Glenda se sintió atraída por la carrera de Bioanallisis Químicos, pues siente que al ser una rama de la medicina, podría no solo tener buenos ingresos para su hogar, sino también servir a las personas el ámbito de salud. Ahora ya tiene veinte años de edad, es madre de un bebe de un año, esposa de un marido que la apoya en el hogar y estudiante del tercer año de la licenciatura de la carrera de Tecnología Médica, a fin a la que siempre se ha sentido cautivada.  
Afortunadamente, esta joven con grandes deseos de superación, cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de su padre con sus pensiones, así también de su hermana que vive en España y manda remesas, y por su puesto ella da su propio esfuerzo para obtener las mejores notas. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora para realizar sus trabajos de la universidad y así invertir el dinero que gastaba en cibercafés en algo propio. En sus planes esta culminar su carrera y establecer un negocio que tiene en mente con su hermana.
texts.en:
Since she was in high school, Glenda has felt attracted to the career of Chemical Bioanalysis.  She feels that by going into a branch of medicine, she can not only obtain a good income for her home, but also serve people with their health.  She is now 20 years old, is a mother of a one year old baby, and wife to a husband who supports her in the home.  He is a third year student in the Medical Technology track, a goal which he has always been drawn to.

Fortunately, this young woman with big dreams of improvement, has the support of her mother and father with their money, and also of her sister who lives in Spain and sends remittances.  She of course gives her own effort to earn the best grades.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a computer to complete her schoolwork and so use the money she spends at cyber cafes on something of her own.  Her plans are to finish her studies and start a business that she has in mind with her sister.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a resident of the district of Qubadiyon. She is 26 years old and she is married. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She lives with her parents-in-law.

Gulnoza has been engaged in agriculture for many years. She planted crops, and now needs to buy some fertilizers for part of her crops. Her savings are not enough, which is why she has asked for a loan. She will use the loan, shared with her remaining savings, to buy more fertilizer.

Gulnoza hopes her crops output will be better this year to provide for her family's consumption and to make sales.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohtobbibi

texts.en:
Mohtobbibi is a light-hearted woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has five children. She is an agrarian; she has a land where she plants agricultural products. She is knowledgeable about her activity as well as how to take care of her plantings. She gained a good harvest this season. She is planning to plant new seeds for next season. 

She requests a loan from KIVA and IMON to buy seeds and fertilizer and to prepare land for planting. She awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to prepare land for planting

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 44-year-old married mother of one child. She started fifteen years ago working as a secretary in a hospital to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their child.  

Marina is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is always depriving herself to give her child the best. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to Marina for it will guarantee her child's future. She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia Elena se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Elena works in food sales, and makes different dishes such as roasted chicken, soup, and meat stir fry.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has 8 years in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

She is requesting the loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.  She is happy for the loan and is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Fredy Javier

texts.es:
El socio Fredy Javier  se dedica al negocio de confección de muebles en melamina, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar melamina y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Fredy Javier, makes a living manufacturing melamine furniture. He has been in this business for many years, and he does very well. His dream is to expand his furniture sale business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy melamine and tools. He is happy to receive this loan, and he promises to make his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy melamine and tools.

loans.name: Los Dulces Group

texts.es:
Como es usual en muchas de las comunidades veracruzanas, el calor es intenso y predominante la mayor parte del año. Dicha característica ha hecho que nombren a una localidad como “la novia del sol” cuyas principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura. El grupo Los Dulces es originario de allí y está integrado por: María y Guadalupe P quienes venden ropa; Carmela, antojitos y dulces; Ana M, pollo; Luisa, dulces, ropa y sandalias; Concepción, antojitos típicos; Ana E, zapatos; Graciela, dulces; Luz, perfumes y Guadalupe M quien maneja un club nutricional.
   Doña Carmela es una mujer dedicada al cuidado de sus tres hijos, especialmente a uno que aun depende económicamente de ella y su esposo Marco. Mela, como es llamada por sus conocidos, tiene diez años de experiencia en la venta de tacos y comida típica todos los fines de semana a partir de las seis de la tarde. En un inicio sólo contaba con una mesa  para los comensales y una superficie donde colocaba un comal  para preparar la carne y a un costado verdura, tortillas, servilletas y platos.
