Ella comenta, “gracias a dios con las ganancias que generé he ampliado mi negocio” ya que ha podido comprar dos mesas de madera, sillas, un cajón de preparación además de cercar y remodelar su casa.
   El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de carne, aceite, chiles, platos y un comal siendo éstos los productos que más utiliza. Por otro lado con las ganancias generadas solventará los estudios de su hija menor y apoyará a otra que estudia una carrera profesional. Una de sus metas a corto plazo es construir una gran taquería la cual será el patrimonio de sus dos hijas. “Estoy muy contenta por contar con mi familia y por la productividad de mi actividad la cual he logrado gracias a la inversión realizada con cada préstamo otorgado” comenta alegremente.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Mela quien viste blusa floreada y está junto al exhibidor de botanas.
texts.en:
As is usual in many of the Veracruz community, the heat is intense predominantly most of the year. This feature has made the city known as "the bride of the sun", whose principle economic activities are livestock and agriculture. The group Los Dulces is form here and is composed of: María and Guadalupe P who sell clothes; Carmela who sells snacks and sweets; Ana M who sells chicken; Luisa who sells sweets, clothes and sandals; Concepción, who sells typical snacks; Ana E who sells shoes; Graciela who sells sweets; Luz who sells perfumes and Guadalupe M who runs a nutrition club.

Carmela is a woman dedicated to caring for her three children, particularly for one who is economically dependent on her and her husband Marco. Mela, as she is called by her friends, has ten years of experience in the sale of tacos and typical food all weekends from six in the afternoon. Initially she only had a table for diners and an area with a griddle where she prepared meat and vegetables, tortillas, napkins and plates. She says "thank god I generated profits that have expanded my business", since she has been able to buy two wooden tables, chairs, and a preparation drawer so she can further fence and remodel her house.

The loan requesting will be invested in the purchase of meat, oil, peppers, plates and a comal as these are the products she uses most. On the other hand with the earnings generated she can pay for the studies of her youngest daughter and support the other who is studying a professional career. One of her short-term goals is to construct a large taquería which will be the heritage of her two daughters. "I am very happy to have my family and for the productivity of my work which I have achieved thanks to the investment made for each loan granted" she says cheerfully.

*The photo was taken int he business of Doña Mela who is wearing the floral blouse and is next to the display of snacks.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil, chiles, peppers, plates and a comal.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
La socia Estefa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Estefa continues to make a living from her grocery store business. She sells staple goods like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies, working from 8 A.M. until 7 P.M. She has already been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is seeking a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

She is happy for the loan and commits to meet her payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 40 years old. She is married, and they have three children.

She operates a green grocery store, as well as farming for ten years.

This is her second loan with VisionFund, and she intends to use it to buy groceries to sell. She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives with her big family in Arevshat village. She is the mother of three adult children. 
Ruzanna and her husband run their family farm. They raise livestock and cultivate potatoes, carrot and garlic. Ruzanna's children help her a lot with the farm. They realize how important is to have a good harvest, to sell it in the local market and earn income for the family. 

Ruzanna has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of the roof and purchase forage for the livestock.

Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Ruzanna  is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the roof and purchase forage for the livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old. She is married with two children.

She operates a hair salon as well as farming. She has been farming for six years.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to pay school fees as well as buy a hair dryer for her salon.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her salon to be a major business.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer for her salon and pay school fees.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 68 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos de 44 y 36 años de edad, quienes ya tienen sus propias familias, en su casa solo vive con su esposo que trabaja en la agricultura, siembra granos básicos, además viven dos nietos de ella, que trabajan de jornaleros en diferentes trabajos en la comunidad.- No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a que sus padres murieron cuando ella apenas tenía trece años y estaba el conflicto armado en el país.

Marcelina, se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales desde que tenía trece años de edad cuando sus padres murieron.- Desde entonces vende dos o cuatro veces a la semana, pero también desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de pollos de engorde. 

Marcelina, necesita el crédito para comprar tres cerdos, cien pollos de engorde, harinilla, concentrado, maíz y tratamientos para engordarlos, para luego venderlos y obtener ingresos económicos, que le serán de ayuda para sostener a la familia.

Marcelina, sueña con comprar un terreno propio, para hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 68 and mother of two children who are 44 and 36 years old and already have families of their own. She lives in her house with her husband who works in agriculture and plants bulk grains. In addition, two grandchildren of her who work as day labourers in different jobs in the community also live with them. She never had a chance to study because her parents died during the country's civil war when she was barely thirteen years old.

Marcelina has been selling bread and tamales since she was thirteen years old and her parents died. Since then she sells two or four times per week and has also been raising pigs and broiler chickens for five years.

Marcelina needs a loan to buy three pigs, 100 broiler chickens, middlings, concentrated feed, maize and supplies to fatten the pigs so that she can sell them later on and obtain an income that will be helpful to support her family.

Marcelina dreams of buying a land of her own to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy three pigs, 100 broiler chickens, middlings, concentrated feed, maize and supplies to fatten the pigs.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is aged 45, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been in constructing building and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art, he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his carrier. He uses tools such as brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level, which have became wearing out. 

He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools.
 
Therefore, Kaneezhas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; so that her husband can be empower to buy tools for construction.
She thanks Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's construction services.

loans.name: Kusyomomo Marikiti Group

texts.en:
Alice is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo; a member Kusyomomo Marikiti Group. She is fifty four years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

She is engaged in mixed farming; and mostly involved in keeping indigenous poultry. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy indigenous poultry, poultry vaccines and the chicken feeds. This will enable her increase poultry production for increased income to pay family expenses e.g. food, modern housing, and school fees.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy indigenous poultry, vaccines and chicken feeds hence increase poultry production for increased income to pay for family expenses e.g. food,modern housing and school fees.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is 54 years old. She is married, and they have four children.

She does farming, growing maize, cowpeas and beans. She has been in business for 15 years.

This is her second loan with VisionFund, and she will use it to buy a water tank and seeds. She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and seeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 64 years old. She is a widow and has four children. 

She sells household products such as cups, spoons, plates, detergents, and insect sprays. She has been in the business for five years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock, especially insect sprays.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to increase her operating capital in order to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big business to generate enough income to meet her family's needs comfortably.

loans.use: to buy stocks like insect spray chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, cassava, sorghum, and Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a 40-year-old lady. She is married and has six children.

She does farming as well as livestock trade and has been in the business for 15 years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund. She intends to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs like seedlings for planting. 

She will use the profit from her business to increase business capital for buying livestock as well as to pay school fees.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her farming business to give her high yields, buy and sell more livestock, and be more financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs like seedlings for planting

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 52 years old. She is married and has 3 children. 

Joyce buys and sells goats and has been in the business for 5 years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy goats for sale. 

She intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repair her house. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy goats for sale

loans.name: Muthunthini Stars Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Akata, 29 years old and married with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from the training they offer, especially in enterprise development. 

She operates a general store, currently selling fruits and vegetables. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cereals to expand her grocery store for increased income. This will enable her to pay the school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy cereals to expand her general store and earn more income to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is involved in the hog raising business. She is 41 years old and married. Yolanda and her family live in Amulung. 

Yolanda also sells vegetables as another source of income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital in developing her business. She will buy feed for her hogs' sustenance and buy vegetables to re-sell too. She will pay back her loan in full and will save additional revenue as family's emergency reserves.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks as well as chicken feeds

loans.name: Kiyonga Elderly Tutungukye Farmer's Group

texts.en:
Cosia is a hardworking and married man with six children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is 47 years old cattle keeper and is in cattle business supplemented with milk selling for daily income. He has been in this business for several years and has been able to sustain himself and the family at large. 

His dream is to educate his children and a business goal of expanding his cattle farm. His challenges are the unpredictable weather changes and low capital base but under the group in its 2nd cycle, Cosia is requesting for the loan to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 56 years old. He is married with six children. He operates a hardware store and has been in the business for one year. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy more stock of cement, steel bars, nails, screws and bolts for sale and to make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to provide food for his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a wholesaler of building materials.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cement, steel bars, nails, screws, and bolts for sale

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sopha is 45-year-old and she has a child who is in school. She does rice farm and works for others for a fee to support her family’s living condition. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty-five years. Her crops have been destroyed by insects so did not grow well which is the main challenge for her business. 

For Sopha, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles already and she has repaid back her past loans successfully. Previous loans have helped her to improve her living standard. Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a new loan of 2,000,000KHR in order to buy fertilizer for farming and pay for labor fees to renovate her old house. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to have better house to stay in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming and pay for labor fees to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
This is Dave with one of the two cows she currently has. "I love animals and I love my cows and I want to add some more to the herd. This is why I need some financial help to do that," said Dave to the loan officer.

Dave is a 56-year-old villager and an widowed mother of four, ranging in age from 16 to 24. She has  been doing agriculture/livestock all these past ten years, to earn a living for her family of six. "After my husband past away, my life became harder financially and physically demanding. I had young kids to take care off. It was tough,but I made it. Extreme poverty is no good for nobody and I have been experiencing it for almost forever," continued Dave the conversation with her loan officer.
  
All in all, Dave has two dairy cows, selling their calves and raw milk sometimes and owns about 8 dynyms of agricultural land where she plants mainly green beans and corn, yet she sells only dried beans since she uses corn as a food for animals. She also has some orchards such as figs, apples and peaches from which she sells fruits.

loans.use: add a dairy cow to the herd of two, which help move her from total poverty

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot and his wife live in Tufashen village of Shirak region. Despite of their young age, the couple runs big farm. They keep livestock (3 cows, 7 calves, 20 sheep, 30 hens) and also cultivate wheat, barley, potato, apricot, cherry, plum, walnut, apple and pear. 
Besides farming, Ashot also works as a laborer in stone mining factory. He does his best to sustain his young family's living costs.
 
The loan will greatly support this family's farm with forage for feeding the livestock. 

Ashot's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. 

Ashot thanks his Kiva lenders and anticipates their support. He is sure that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Markus no longer has to worry about having adequate income to repair his house or move into a bigger home. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his income considerably.  

This season Markus has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize.Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Markus now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 26-year-old single lady who started nine years ago working in clothing shop to cover the needs and expenses of herself and one other family member. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions. 

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary home appliances that she really needs in her house. Fadia hopes to stay capable of providing her family with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy necessary home appliances she needs in her house

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma who is in her late 20s, is married with no children. She has been running two projects, a beauty salon and cosmetics sales, for four years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma's 3rd loan from  Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the salon's equipment and started selling cosmetics. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to reinvest in the business, repay the loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the up to date salon equipment and to increase the cosmetics stock. 

She dreams of owning a clothing shop. Salma will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the up to date salon equipment and to increase the cosmetics stock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia   se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Sonia, makes a living through her crafts business. She sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets, and woven/knitted goods. The member sells a variety of woven/knitted products. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she does very well. Her dream is to expand her business selling fabrics and woven/knitted products.

The member is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters, and woven/knitted goods. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters, and woven/knitted goods.

loans.name: Grupo Arroyo Group

texts.es:
Muchas de las comunidades oaxaqueñas conservan usos y costumbres desde hace muchas generaciones. Una en especial celebra en noviembre al santo de la región para lo cual se programan bailes, juegos mecánicos, fuegos artificiales, partidos de futbol, entre otras cosas.
   De dicha localidad es originario un grupo integrado por diez personas quienes trabajan arduamente por el bien de su familia. Ellos son: Gabriela quien se dedica a vender cosméticos; José y María refrescos; Reyna y Marcela, antojitos típicos; Delfina, antojitos y cosméticos; Juana y Adriana, abarrotes; Irma, artículos de plata e Inés quien brinda servicios de carpintería y de estética.
   Doña Inés y su esposo Víctor tienen 20 años al frente de una carpintería, la clave de su éxito se debe a su dedicación y pasión al trabajo en equipo. Juanita, como le llaman sus conocidos, barniza, mide y pinta los muebles que día a día realizan en el pequeño taller que construyeron en su hogar. Los cuatro hijos de la pareja se involucran en la actividad por las tardes ya que por las mañanas acuden a la escuela. Cabe mencionar que dos de sus hijos cuentan con el patrocinio de World Vision. 
   De igual forma y con el objetivo de brindar mayores beneficios a su familia se ha dedicado al servicio de estilista por las tardes o bien bajo solicitud de sus clientes quienes reconocen su calidad y atención. De este modo, con las ganancias obtenidas, pudo comprar un refrigerador y una nueva estufa.
   Con el préstamo solicitado puede invertir en la carpintería al comprar madera y clavos ya que debe fabricar un comedor y doce sillas para un cliente. “Estoy feliz  dedicándome a mi familia y a mis dos actividades, gracias a los préstamos que me han sido otorgados”, son palabras de Doña Inés quien se muestra muy contenta.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la carpintería de Juanita y su esposo, ella es quien viste blusa color amarillo y se encuentra detrás de uno de los muebles que fabricaron recientemente.
texts.en:
Many of the Oaxacan communities maintain customs and ways that go back many generations.  One special tradition they celebrate in November for the saint of the region, for which they schedule dances, rides, fireworks, soccer games, among other activities.  From this area comes a group made up of ten people who work arduously for the wellbeing of their families.

The group members are: Gabriela who works selling cosmetics, José and María who sell soft drinks, Reyna and Marcela who sell traditional snacks, Delfina who sells snacks and cosmetics, Juana and Adriana who sell groceries, Irma who sells silver items, and Inés who offers carpentry and beauty services.

Inés and her husband Víctor have 20 years at the head of a carpentry workshop.  The key to their success is their dedication and passion to work as a team.  "Juanita", as those who know her call her, varnishes, measures, and paints the pieces of furniture that they make day to day in the small workshop they built in their home.  The couple's four children help with the work in the afternoons since in the mornings they go to school.  It fits to mention that two of their children are sponsored by World Vision.  

In the same way and with the goal of offering more profit to her family, she has worked as a stylist in the afternoons or by small requests from her customers who recognize her quality and attention.  In this way, with the obtained income, she was able to buy a refrigerator and new stove.  

With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the carpentry workshop by purchasing wood and nails since she must make a dining room table and twelve chairs for a customer.  "I am happy working with my family and in my two jobs, thanks to the loans I have been granted" are the words of Inés who seems very content.

*The photograph was taken in Juanita and her husband's carpentry workshop, she is seen wearing the yellow blouse and is behind one of the pieces they recently made.

loans.use: to buy wood and nails to make furniture.

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMDEDIO ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 58 years old. He is married and has 5 children. 

He grows maize, beans, and cow peas and he also keeps cows and goats. 

He has been farming for 10 years. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy a cow for milk production and sales. 

He will use profits from the expanded business to open a mobile money transfer business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production and sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, banana, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 37-year-old married man from Syria.  He started twenty years ago working as a salesman in a cafe to cover the needs and expenses of his family.  He is a hard worker who is trying desperately to improve the living conditions of his family.  

Mohammad's limited salary is not enough to cover all the needs of his family, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new furniture for his house.

Mohammad hopes to open his own business in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his house.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Jaki Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Habila suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Habila has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona, Habila can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Kyaterekera Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Robert is a member of Kyaterekera Village Bank Group where members guarantee each other in order to access credit.  He lives in Hoima, Uganda, and has children between the ages of 4 and 6 years old, and all attend school.  

Robert operates a retail shop, mainly selling salt, sugar, and soap, among other items.  This is supplemented by income from farming, mainly cassava production.  He hopes to grow and expand his business.  He will use the loan to buy more stock like salt, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.en:
Shamsullo is a brave man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1980. He is living in a remote town with his family. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. She raises their children and keeps the household. He is a rental worker. He gets orders and works seasonally.

Shamsullo appealed to IMON to get a loan to be treated at a hospital. He has problems with his health because his work is hard and difficult. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 46 years old, and married, with 3 children.  He has operated a shoe sales business for 20 years, and it has been profitable.  He will be using the loan to buy additional stock of shoes and belts to sell, and hopes this will enable him to earn more income to support his family. 

Daniel's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the business, earn more income, and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shoes and belts to sell.

loans.name: Melida Massiel

texts.es:
La visión por ayudar a las personas en el día a día, fue la principal inspiración de Melida, una madre multifacética de treinta años de edad, quien desde hace ocho años, todos los días se pone ese uniforme azul para trabajar como asistente de una clínica. Además estudia su cuarto año de la licenciatura en psicología, para seguir cumpliendo con ese sueño. 
Afortunadamente Melida posee el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo, de su madre y de su padre para salir adelante.  La motivación le ha servido para solicitar un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación, con el objetivo de obtener pronto su título y aplicar a un mejor puesto para tener mejores ingresos para ella y para su familia. En sus planes esa estabilizarse en su trabajo y llegar a construir su propia clínica privada.
texts.en:
The desire to help people on a day to day basis was Melida's main inspiration. She is a 30-year-old, multifaceted mother who has put on the same blue uniform every day for the past eight years in order to work as an assistant at a clinic. In addition, she is in her fourth year of studies, pursuing a degree in psychology so that she can continue fulfilling her dream.  

Fortunately, Melida has the moral and economic support of her husband, mother, and father to move forward. Their motivation encouraged her to request a loan to cover the cost of her degree courses. Her goal is to finish her degree soon and to apply for a better job in order to earn a higher income for her family. She plans to obtain a stable job and to build her own private clinic one day.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her degree courses.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 56 years old, and married, with 4 children.  She farms maize, cow peas, and beans, and has been in business for 10 years. 

This is Agnes first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to use it to buy seeds and water pumps.  She will use profits from the expanded business to save and buy a green house. 

Agnes's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and water pumps.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. She started six years ago working as a hairdresser from her house in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Sanaa is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well-known among her region. She is very talented lady and has professional skills in this domain. To develop her business more, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain and legally register her car which will facilitate her business. She will become able to visit her customers and buy products and beauty items in an easy way. 

Sanaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain and legally register her car which will facilitate her business

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar has been raising cows, calves in her farm for many years. She also cultivates wheat, potato and beetroot. Gohar's husband sells the gathered agricultural harvest in local market and gets income for family's living costs. The family is working tirelessly toward the attainment of their dream of saving enough money so they can afford to provide their only son appropriate living conditions. 

Gohar asks this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock.

Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Shirak is considered to be a poor region, with a high unemployment rate, and low living standards. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. 

Gohar hopes that working with Kiva lenders will be productive and profitable for her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Yenira Esperanza

texts.es:
Yenira tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Yenira se dedica a la preparación y venta de champú, cachangas, papas rellenas, humitas tamales desde hace 12 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la puerta del mercado de abasto de Oyotún, ella solicita préstamo para la compra de utensilios e insumos para la preparación de los alimentos que vende, con esto podrá atender en mayor volumen la demanda, mejorando de esta forma su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yenira is 39 years old and lives with her son in the district of Oyotún, a community dedicated to farming, trade and livestock, located in the province of Chiclayo – part of the Lamhayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Yenira has made a living for 12 years preparing and selling Peruvian fruit-based drinks, desserts, stuffed potatoes and corn tamales. Her business is located at the entrance of Oyotún’s general market.

She is asking for a loan to purchase utensils and supplies for the preparation of the meals she sells. With this, she will be able to meet a greater volume of demand, thereby improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for the prepared meals she sells.

loans.name: Mehfooz

texts.en:
Mehfooz is a 62-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of 6 children. Her son is a computer seller for past 15 years.
 
Mehfooz's son has to purchase a computer for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means her son cannot afford to purchase this item.
Therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her son to purchase this merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also him her son to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Mehfooz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy another machine for her son's computer business

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
A single woman is 44 years old living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, Sary does rice farming and raises chicken to support her living condition. She has been involved in her businesses for twenty-four years. Her daily business income is about 40,000KHR per day and she can save around 20,000KHR each day after her family’s expenses. Because of insects have destroyed her crops, it causes her to not have enough funds to do farming for this season. 

A loan amount of 2,500,000KHR is her second loan cycle via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She improved her lifestyle from her past loan. Sary will manage her entire loan to buy fertilizer for supporting her crops to produce more yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to upgrade her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her crops to produce more yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El socio Gilberto se dedica al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza trabajos de casas, pintados entre otros, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener una  empresa de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y brochas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Gilberto, makes a living as a construction worker. He performs various household jobs, including painting, among others. He has several years of experience in the business, and it is going very well. 

His dream is to have a construction business. He is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as paints and paintbrushes. 

Gilbert is happy because of the loan and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as paints and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio Julio  se dedica al negocio de transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Julio works in the business of transportation. He has a car which serves as a taxi. He has worked 7 years in this business and it's going very well for him. Hi dream is to buy a new car. He is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car.

The member is very grateful for this loan and promises to make all his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia  se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de un colegio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la sociao por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia is continuing to work as a teacher in a school.  She works from 8am until 2pm.  Through this work, she wants to continue to make progress in life.  Her dream is to have her own school.  Sonia is requesting a loan to buy a television set for her house.

Sonia is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy a television set

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 48 years old, married with two children and lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. She has fattened pigs to sell since 2010. Her husband is a 50-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, one of her children works in another country, one works in a factory and the last two attend school.

Sokha would like to request a loan, which is her fourth Kiva loan through Kredit MFI, because she is short of the funds to buy pig feed for her pigs. This loan will help her have enough funds to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finances from selling those pigs. In the future, she is going to build a new house and support her studying children in earning high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 38 years old. He is married and blessed with seven school going children. He has had a livestock farming business for the last four years and the business is doing well. 

He will be using the loan to purchase goats  and hopes this will help him have funds to educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase goats to help him have funds to educate his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and goats

loans.name: Eliselda

texts.en:
Eliselda is 24 years old and married with one child.  Eliselda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Eliselda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Eliselda has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eliselda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yoni ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank "San Antonio de Padua"  This group is from Echarate district, in the La Convencion province of the department of Cusco.

Yoni is a member of this group.  She is 45 years old and has 2 children.  She has a restaurant where she makes a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and meat dishes.  She works from 8am until 8pm, and she already has a number of years of experience with the business, which is doing very well.  She is requesting a loan to buy products to cook such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members have businesses selling animals, working in agriculture, selling groceries, and one has a restaurant business.  

Yoni thanks those who are making her dreams possible through these loans, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Villa San Blas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA SAN BLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Macaria ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo,carne y verduras.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo y no pudieron llegar a tiempo a la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank, Villa San Blas. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province and department of Cusco. 

The group member is Macaria who is single and 42 years old and has six children. 

Macaria works at her restaurant business where she prepares different plates such as chicken with potatoes, soups and chipped beef. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes that because of her business her children are able to finish their studies. 

She works from 10:00 AM until 5:00 PM. She has more than seven years of experience in the business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is asking for a loan in order to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, chicken, beef and vegetables. 

The members not pictured in the group photo, which was taken after than their meeting, were not able to attend because of work and could not arrive on time for the meeting.  

The other members make a living selling vegetables, selling animals, running a grocery store business and having a restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Sanoeun's Group

texts.en: Sanoeun is 29 years old and a married mother of two dependent children not yet in school. She resides in Kratie Province where she has grown cassava and cashews for ages. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn additional income. The crop produced low quality products, which could be sold at a lower price. Thus, she decided to form a group of three members to request a new loan, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), to save her family’s business. Sanoeun, who is the group leader, will use her entire loan portion to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to better support her cassava farming business. She hopes to expand her business to get more income so as to secure the needs in her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to better support her cassava farming business.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been managing to feed his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Suraiya has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Suraiya has requested a loan so that her son can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Suraiya is a 54-year-old woman, living with her eight children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 28 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a retail shop business for the last five years, and the business is doing great .

He will be using the loan to purchase stock for his shop, and he hopes that the resulting profits will help him build rental houses. His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop, and he hopes that the resulting profits will help him build rental houses.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es de la ciudad de Caacupé, está estudiando la carrera de medicina, y comenta que por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Él está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que se esfuerza.
Pide este préstamo para poder su matriculación y derechos de exámenes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Marcos is from the city of Caacupé. He's studying medicine and he says he wants to be able to help other people through his program. He's putting all his effort into being able to grow and get ahead. He's a very self-sacrificing person who wants to be someone in life, so he's making an effort.

Marcos is requesting this loan so he can pay his tuition and exam fees. He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay his tuition and exam fees

loans.name: Celeste

texts.es:
Celeste actualmente está en el último año de la Licenciatura en profesorado en Guaraní es Docente y su meta es recibir su título para poder seguir creciendo como profesional.
Celeste es una persona que quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que se esfuerza.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder pagar ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Celeste is currently in the last year of her teaching program in Guarani. She's a teacher and her goal is to get her degree and continue to grow professionally.

Celeste is someone who wants to continue to grow, so she's making an effort.

She's requesting this loan to pay the expenses of her degree fees.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 29 years old. She is married with six children. She has had a farming business for five years, and it has been profitable.

Jennifer will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds and manure. She hopes this will help her open a shop.

With the anticipated profits, Jennifer will be able to restock her shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to pay school fees and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds and manure, to help her open a shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, es un grupo nuevo que se formó en la localidad de Santaní, son mujeres jefas de familias que luchan por poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. SALVADORA es integrante de este comité, ella es muy guapa y emprendedora, se desempeña como limpiadora en un colegio de la comunidad en horas de la mañana, y también cría animales como vacas, chanchos, gallinas, patos, etc., como todas sus socias, es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su cría como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras is a new group that formed in the town of Santaní. The women are heads of family who strive to be able to give their loved ones everything they weren't able to have.

Salvadora is a member of this group. She's very attractive and enterprising. In the morning she works as a cleaner in a school in the community. She also raises animals such as cows, pigs, chickens, ducks, and so forth. Like all the members, she's a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy balanced feed for her animals. That way she can continue with what she has been doing: raising animals. She's grateful for this opportunity to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Lord Is My Light Group

texts.en:
Getrude is a 31-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of the Lord Is My Light group, which is made up of three women. Getrude is married and has two children.

Getrude is a poultry farmer. She rear chicks. She feeds them three times a day and keeps them in a fence until they are mature enough to be sold to customers. She has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Getrude established her business so that she can support her children's education. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children with the profit she earns from her business. She also invests back into her business.

Getrude and her group members need a loan totaling GHS 3,100, of which Getrude will receive GHS 1,500. She will use this to buy more more chicks, and feed to rear the chicks until they are mature enough to sell to customers. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Getrude plans to save more money to provide for her children’s education. She believes educating her children through the university level will better their lives.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, and feed to rear the chicks until they are mature enough to sell to customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children living in Masindi-Uganda. She sells clothes to earn a salary. She is a hard-working woman and has managed to sustain her family. She hopes to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

Josephine is challenged by inadequate capital. She wants a loan to buy clothes and bags for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул добрая и честная женщина. Она всю жизнь прожила, зарабатывая своим честно нажитым трудом. Она зарабатывает на жизнь, предоставляя услуги портнихи на дому. Зебогул уже много лет работает на этой швейной машинке, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Она мечтает о новой модернизированной машинке, но не имеет средств купить. Зебогул обратилась за кредитом веря, что здесь ей помогут и ее мечта осуществится.
texts.en: Zebogul is a kind and honest woman. She has lived her entire life making her own honest and hard earned income. She makes a living by offering her services as a seamstress out of her home. Zebogul has worked on this sewing machine for many years, the one that you see in this photograph. She dreams of a new, modernized sewing machine, but she does not have the funds to buy one. Zebogul applied for a loan, trusting that they could help her realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a new, modernized sewing machine.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Neang is 42 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her.

Neang has been growing paddy rice for 24 years to earn the main income to support her family’s needs. Now, one of her children is working in a garment factory to supplement the family’s income.

Neang's rice crop was heavily threatened by pests and drought. Consequently, she cannot manage to earn a good income as before.

Neang is now leading a three-member group to apply for a loan, and it will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees and purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice farming business to enable her children to study until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina emprendedoras, están en el 3er. ciclo con 16 integrantes, ellas son muy luchadoras y emprendedoras, que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Matilde quién se dedica a la venta de ropas, y comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y gracias a sus ventas está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Matilde pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emprendedoras Group is in its third loan cycle with 16 members who want to improve their living conditions through their joint effort. They're all very persevering and enterprising.

One of the members is Matilde, who earns a living selling clothing. She says she has a lot of customers who always make a lot of requests. Thanks to her sales she's improving her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

Matilde's requesting this loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, and other clothing so she can keep striving to improve every day. She's grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, and other clothing

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 48 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children, three of whom are still studying.

Her husband is the main income source in the family. He is a retired soldier in the Lebanese Army and works as a van driver. As for Aida, she is only focusing on her family.

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help her children to pursue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her child's school registration fees.

loans.name: Urugwiro Cb Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 38 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 24 years, four of whom go to school.

Zainabu is a group leader. The group is called Urugwiro, which means “happiness” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to change their futures for the better.

Zainabu has a shop and has been running a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassavas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassavas for sale.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is a 30-year-old hardworking single mother of one child, aged 11 years. She operates a bar and lodge as her main business, which she started in order to get income and cater for her child and family.

Queen's vision is to expand her business and build her own house, but she is challenged by stubborn customers (bad debtors) who refuse to pay after taking drinks.

She is accessing credit to top up her savings and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to top up her savings and buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 30-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He works as an employee with a low and unstable income. He also has a rickshaw, which he uses for transferring goods for the local traders. This job provides him with a good income where he can cover part of the family expenses.

Karam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one. This will enable him to improve his business.

Karam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw in place of the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cattle to start his business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de cincuenta y siete años de edad, muy carismática y trabajadora. Desde hace dos años ella decidió convertirse en una mujer comerciante, puso un negocio de venta de golosinas, frituras, gaseosas, comida, entre otras cosas, dentro de un parque cercano a su casa de habitación. En poco tiempo, su negocio ha crecido notablemente. 
Dada su creciente demanda, ella necesita abastecerse de productos, es por eso que ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le ayude a comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros productos. En futuro planea hacer de su negocio una comideria.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 57-year-old very charismatic and hard-working woman. Some two years ago, she decided to become a merchant woman. She established her own business selling sweets, fried snacks, soft drinks, and meals, among other things. It is located in a park near her home. Within a short time, her business has grown notably.

Given the growing demand, Josefina needs to restock her store with merchandise. For that reason, she has approached Kiva, through MiCredito, to obtain financing to help her purchase rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, and sweets, among other products.

In the future, Josefina plans to convert her business into a location that offers meals.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, and sweets, among other products, to sell.

loans.name: Ay's Group

texts.en:
Ay, who is 39 years old and a married mother, resides with three children in Kampong Cham province. She has a child in school who needs her to support studying.

Ay has been growing rice as the main source of family income for 21 years, and she is also fishing to supplement income. Her rice crop was heavily threatened by pests and drought; therefore, she cannot manage to earn good income.

Ay now leads a group of six members to take out a new loan, which will be the second cycle for her, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was fully paid back, and it was helpful to her, as it enabled her to better support to her family and keep her children in school.

Ay, who is the group leader, will use her entire loan portion to purchase organic fertilizers and organic pesticides for her rice farming business and to buy fishing net for her fishing business. She hopes her rice crop will grow healthily and produce good outputs so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and organic pesticides for her rice farming business and to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 24-year-old mother of one child, living in a rural area of Kratie Province. Nowadays, she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. 

She has been involved in her cassava farm for ten years. This is first time for Mom to work with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the group leader of three members, she is going to spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get income from her cassava farm so she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farmland.

loans.name: Dionisio Antonio

texts.es:
Dionisio es un orgullo y pujante arriero de 67 años de edad, un ser que saca gusto de sus días, dedicado cuerpo y alma al trabajo y a su familia, aprendió de sus padres todo lo relacionado con el campo, desde agricultura, hasta la cría de animales, la cría de pollos y la agricultura ha sido el sustento de su familia a lo largo de su vida.

Dionisio es padre de 4 hijos, por ellos labora fuertemente, por dejarles un buen futuro, les enseña valiosos valores como valerse por sí mismos, enseñanzas valioso que de seguro estarán presentes en sus corazones.

El deseo de este trabajador hombre es comprar una casa, un sueño que que aún sigue en su mente.

Le gustaría solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, como lo son: fertilizantes, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 67, is a proud and thriving mule driver, a person who derives pleasure from his days, dedicated in body and soul to his work and his family. He learned everything having to do with the country from his family, from farming to raising animals. Raising chickens and farming have been his family's sustenance his entire life.

Dionisio is the father of four children. He works very hard to leave them a good future. He teaches them worthwhile values such as how to be self-sufficient, lessons they certainly hold close in their hearts.

This hardworking man wants to buy a house, a dream he still thinks about.

Dionisio would like to request a loan to buy agricultural inputs to take care of his crops: fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, fungicide, and insecticide.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to take care of his crops: fertilizer, irrigation, pesticide, fungicide, and insecticide

loans.name: Diana Lucia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer soltera de 34 años de edad, residente de las zonas rurales del municipio de Sonson, donde ha salido adelante junto con su familia con su negocio de venta de leche.

Es madre cabeza de hogar, tiene un pequeño de 7 años de edad, su principal sueño es brindarle a este niño las herramientas necesarias para ser una gran persona y se forme profesionalmente en una buena universidad.

Diana no solo tiene su meta con su hijo, desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener amplios terrenos y un gran número de animales.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vaca, busca aumentar su producción y la respalda el terreno que cuenta para alimentarla con pasto.

Su principal beneficio es el aumento en su capital al producir mayor cantidad de litros de leche.
texts.en: Diana is a single 34 year old woman. She lives in the rural areas of the town of Sonson, where she has gotten ahead with her family and her business selling milk. She is the head of the house and has a 7 year old child. Her main dream is to give this child the necessary tools to be a great person and to be educated in a good university. Diana does not only have a goal for her son, she hopes to improve the conditions of her house, to have ample land and a large number of animals. She wants to ask for a loan to buy a cow, in order to increase her production and the area of land where the cow feeds on grass. Her main benefit is the increase in money by producing more liters of milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow, in order to increase her production and the area of land where the cow feeds on grass.

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en:
My lives in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district.  She is a 55-year-old widow woman, who has a child. 

She has done rice farming to support her living standard for thirty-seven years. The problem with her farming is that it has been destroyed by insects and her rice does not grow well. She has never been with VisionFund before, and this is the first time for her to take a Kiva loan. 

As the group leader of four, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to produce larger yields in order to earn a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
Juvenal es un típico agricultor antioqueño, un hombre pujante que desde pequeño le inculcaron los valores del trabajo y la honradez, con sus tierras ha generado una buena calidad de vida para los suyos.

Su hogar está conformado por su esposa y 5 hijos, 3 de ellos menores de edad, los cuales son su fuente de inspiración su motor de vida, para Juvenal verlos sonreír y crecer es el mayor placer de la vida y quiere presente facilitándoseles las herramientas que necesitan para convertirse en unas excelentes personas.

El principal objetivo de su vida es tener un campo fértil y amplio para dejarlo de herencia a sus hijos y puedan valerse por si algo llegase a pasar.

Juvenal se acerca a interactuar para solicitar un préstamo, encontrado un sí por respuesta y ofreciéndole la oportunidad de pertenecer a la maravillosa comunidad Kiva la cual la integran, personas que apuestan por el progreso de lo más necesitados.

Solicita un préstamo para construir un invernadero, necesita madera, plástico e insumos agrícolas para la compra de abono, venenos y pagar la respectiva mano de obra.
texts.en:
Juvenal is a traditional Antioquia farmer. He is a vigorous man who was instilled with work values and honesty from a young age. With his land, he has generated a good quality of life for his loved ones. His home is composed of his wife and 5 children, 3 of them being minors, who are his source of inspiration and his driving force. For Juvenal, seeing them smile and grow is the greatest joy in life and he wants to make it easy for them to get the tools they need to become excellent people. 

The main goal in his life is to have a fertile and ample field to leave as an inheritance for his children and they can take care of themselves if something happens. Juvenal has approached Interactuar to ask for a loan, getting a "yes" for an answer and giving him the opportunity to belong to the wonderful Kiva community that is made up of people who are committed to the advancement of the most needy. He is asking for a loan to build a greenhouse. He needs wood, plastic and agricultural supplies, to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay the respective labor.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse. He needs wood, plastic and agricultural supplies, to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay the respective labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chicken, dairy products, sausages, crates, scales and other things to increase her sales and earnings.

loans.name: Amany

texts.en: Amany is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband with no children. Her husband is the income source in the family in order to fulfill their family needs and improve their lifestyle. And according to her, she doesn’t work as she is only focusing on her studies. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her English course fees which make her very happy that she will be able to pursue her education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her English course fees.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman aged 32 years with two children who are nine and five years old and are both in school. She lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with her family. She has a drug shop and she has been doing it for six years. She supplements her family income with a salary which she earns as a nurse at a local government hospital.

She started her business with the aim of getting money to increase the family income since her salary could not cover all her family expenses. She was also assured of a market from residents since usually government facilities are not well facilitated with the medication needed by the patients.

She is acquiring this loan facility in order to restock her drug shop. Her clients are fellow residents from around her area and her dream is to expand her business and start selling wholesale but her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital and delay of payments by her customers.

She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To boost her pharmacy by buying more of the stock needed

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
A pesar de tener 66 años de edad, de quedar viuda, de atravesar diversos momentos adversos en su vida, y de criar sola a sus 5 hijos, la señora Guillermina no renunció a su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y ser empresaria, por lo cual, aunque no contaba con historial crediticio, y muchas instituciones financieras la rechazaron, persevero en su lucha, logrando un “si” en Interactuar, lo cual le permitió disponer de los recursos económicos necesarios para poner en marcha su negocio de cría de pollos.
Gracias a esto Guillermina ha logrado generar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de su familia sin necesidad de recurrir a donaciones de terceros.
Anímate a darle la oportunidad Guillermina que no tiene límites de edad en su afán por salir adelante.
texts.en: Despite being 66 years old, being a widow, going through many bad times in her life, and raising 5 children on her own, Guillermina has not given up her dream of improving her quality of life and being a businesswoman. So, although she has no credit history and many financial institutions denied her, she persevered in her fight. She got a "yes" from Interactuar, which allowed her to have the necessary economic resources to start her business raising chickens. Thanks to this, Guillermina has managed to generate the necessary resources to support herself and her family without the need to use third-party donations. Go for it and give Guillermina a chance because there are no age limits in her quest to get ahead.

loans.use: to start a business raising chickens.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Fidea, who is in his late 30s, is married with no child. He has been a food vendor for twelve years now. He works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fidea's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing and improving his food business and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to reinvest in the business, saved some in the bank to repay the loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his food stock and sell to many customers. He dreams of owning a cafeteria.

Fidea will share this loan with his loan group, Tujikwamue Ukonga, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his food stock and sell to many customers.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, cooking oil, etc. 

Eva requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more stock. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, detergent soap, soft drinks, candies, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 54-year-old housewife living in a sector in Amman called Salt. She is the mother of four children. She is very ambitious and helpful and she wants to be a productive woman in any way. Her husband Ahmad appears in the photo instead of her because she is a conservative woman.

Muna's husband works for a low income and he believes that his income is not enough to cover his family standards. So he decided to provide another source of income, a car station, to wash, change oil and do maintenance.

Muna decided to support her husband and apply for a loan to help him expand his station and to buy oil and new machines and tools to increase the quality of the work. Also they will use it to end the license things.

loans.use: to support her husband and apply for a loan to help him expand his station and to buy oil and new machines and tools.

loans.name: Jader Luis

texts.es:
Jader es una persona Humilde, trabajadora, recursiva, perseverante, que no se detiene antes las adversidades y que con su negocio ha salido adelante junto con su familia que la conforman su pareja y 4 hijos. 

Jader vive en un humilde hogar (ver foto), construido en madera, siempre ha soñado ver este lugar construido en material y trabaja  para lograrlo. 

Se dedica al reciclaje, una actividad que depende mucho del capital de trabajo para comprar insumos y materiales, y dado que Jader es padre de una familia numerosa no cuenta con muchos recursos para potenciar su actividad, es por ello que quiere recurrir a la ayuda de un crédito para contar con el dinero con el que compra plástico, cartón, envases, entre otros tipo de materiales, también, parte del dinero será destinado a la mecánica de la motocicleta en la que transporta todos los pedidos.
texts.en:
Jadar is a simple, hardworking, methodical, and determined person who doesn't let problems get in his way. His business has allowed him and his family to get ahead. He has a wife and four children.

Jadar lives in a simple house (see photo) made of wood. He is working towards his dream of having a home made of sturdier materials.

To earn his living Jadar works in recycling, a job that requires much working capital to buy supplies and materials. As he has a big family, he doesn't have much money to spend on these items. For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy plastic, cardboard, containers etc. A part of the money will also be used to repair the motorcycle he uses to transport his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy items for recycling

loans.name: Estebana Sofia

texts.es:
Estebana es una mujer de 51 años de edad, una persona que toda la vida ha vivido en el campo en donde encontró una pareja para vivir y con la cual tiene 3 hijos.

Estebana siempre se ha caracterizado por generar sus propios ingresos, es una mujer independiente que con su negocio de cría de cerdos ha logrado crear una estabilidad económica en su hogar, claro con gran aporte de su esposo que vela por la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar.

Su propósito central con su negocio, es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, enfocándose en la reparación de su residencia y en la ampliación de su negocio, permitiéndose competir con los demás porcicultores de la zona.
Desea solicitar un préstamo para la adecuación de los chiqueros, construcción de canales de alimentación y canales de desecho.

Este préstamo le permitirá tener unos establecimientos en óptimas condiciones para operar su negocio y tener la oportunidad de albergar una mayor cantidad de cerdos.
texts.en:
Estebana is a 51-year-old woman who has lived her entire life in the country. It is there that she found her life-partner, with whom she has three children.

Estebana has always been characterized by generating her own income. She is an independent woman, who with her pig-raising business, has been able to create economic stability in her home.
Of course, she has done this with the great support of her husband, who covers the greater part of the household expenses.

Her central purpose with her business is to improve her housing conditions, focusing on the repair of her residence and on the expansion of her business, which will allow her to compete with the other pig farmers in the zone.

She wants to request a loan for adapting the pigsties and for the construction of feeding chutes and waste chutes.

This loan will allow her to have facilities with optimal conditions for operating her business, and to have the opportunity to hold a greater quantity of pigs.

loans.use: to adapt the pigsties, and construct feeding chutes and waste chutes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and they cooperate together in order to fulfill their needs. She has been working as a private teacher since 2009. She has organized a special room at her domicile where she receives students and has outfitted it with the necessary materials. Today, she is applying for a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a scientific encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills and therefore increase her income. She notes that this will facilitate her work preparation and she wishes to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a scientific encyclopedia

loans.name: Silfredo Jose

texts.es:
