She shares her life with her parents and older siblings which work independently. They live in their own home built with adobe and straw, with a roof made out of corrugated iron and floor made out of brick. She relies on electricity and water from a well extracted by a pump, and there is no sewage system.

She studies in the field of topography and is currently in year 1 out of 3 years. She enjoyes helping other people and to study the graphical representation of the Earth's surface. Her character is of service. "I study topography and work part-time, both activities occupy my day", she says. While she studies, she works in a photocopy center part-time. The advantage of her studies is that it doesn't interfere with her work. The disadvantage is that she lacks capital to buy a laptop. Her dream is to finish her professional career. She wishes to buy a laptop to continue her studies in a satisfactory manner. This is the first loan with the institution during the first year that she dedicates herself to professional studies.

It is for these reason that Daniela is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to continue her studies and finish her professional career.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to continue with her studies and finish her professional career.

loans.name: Sor Maria

texts.es:
Sor es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 37 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de empanadas, pasteles y buñuelos. 

Madre de 2 hijos que depende totalmente de ella, ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de ingredientes como harina, queso, entre otros, para aumentar su materia prima y por ende su producción.
 
Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Sor elaborara mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus dos hijos
texts.en:
Sor is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, since, at the age of 37, she works untiringly every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday, in her business of producing empanadas, cakes, and buñuelos [doughnuts].

The mother of two children who depend completely on her, she sees an opportunity in an organization that offers her the confidence to have a loan to improve her business and to dream of her food production factory and make her believe that it is possible to achieve this dream.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of ingredients such as flour and cheese, among other items, in order to increase her basic supplies and, in the end, her production.

With the help of this loan, Señora Sor will make more food, and it will allow her to obtain better income so that every day she can give her two children better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour and cheese, among other items, in order to increase her basic supplies and, in the end, her production.

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 51 años de edad, una persona persistente que ha sabido aprovechar su terreno y su hogar para producir dinero y es que un pequeño monto e capital le permitió adecuar su vivienda y convertirla en un hostal, un hogar de paso en la zona de lorica.

Elsa al iniciar esta actividad en el año 2003, no imagino que se convertirá en la principal fuente de ingresos de su hogar y ahora con mucho orgullo quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su negocio, ya que con el monto solicitado, comprara aire acondicionado, para atraer mayor número de usuarios dado que en Lorica hace bastante calor, comprara cemento, arena, baldosas para poner cerámica al suelo, tener todas las divisiones en material.

Con tu ayuda, esta empresaria tendrá el capital suficiente para realizar las modificaciones deseadas, con lo que buscara atraer clientes y generar mejores ingresos, para que su familia que la conforman su pareja y 5 hijos viva mejor.
texts.en:
Elsa, 51, is a persistent woman who has been able to make the most of her plot of land and her home to earn money. A small amount of capital allowed her to refurbish her home and convert it into a guesthouse, temporary housing in the Lorica area. Elsa never imagined that it would become the main source of income for her household when she started this enterprise in 2003.

Now, with great pride, she wants to request a loan to improve her business. With the requested sum she'll buy an air conditioner to attract more customers, because it's quite hot in Lorica. She's going to buy cement and sand to put ceramic tiles on the floor and have all the rooms equipped.

With your help this entrepreneur will have the capital she needs to make the desired modifications so she can attract customers and earn more income. That way her family--her partner and her five children--will live better.

loans.use: to offer guest services.  She wants to buy an air conditioner and items for making repairs

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Aygehovit village in Armenia where she lives with her husband. Their only son has migrated to a neighboring country with the hope of finding a better-paying job and helping out his parents. Her husband and she are farmers who cultivate corn, haricot beans, potatoes, cucumbers, peppers and in the orchard grow plums, cherries, figs, walnuts, apples and pears.

This will be the second loan Aida has received. Unfortunately, the first loan that she took out from a local financial institution was very difficult to pay back, and Aida faced some trouble repaying it. However, thanks to her and her husband’s hard work since then, they have been able to operate their farm in such a way that they will be able to cover the monthly payments.

Now Aida has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. She will receive 500 USD to be used to buy a pig and forage to feed it.

Please support Aida with her loan and help her to sustain her farm. The couple is working tirelessly in the hopes of saving enough money so their son can come back and live together with his family.

loans.use: to pay for a pig and forage for feeding it

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es: Cuando Nancy era casi una adolecente, a sus 11 años fue enviada por su madre a ayudar a una señora llamada Rosa para que le realizara diligencias y como está señora tenía un taller de confecciones, ella observaba como cocían las operarias y aprendió algunas técnicas de costura; inició realizando pequeñas labores, sin embargo su interés en este arte con el pasar del tiempo se fue haciendo cada vez mayor.  Busco el respaldo de una entidad estatal y realizó unos cursos para perfeccionarse en la labor y cuando se hizo una experta, inició su taller de confecciones que a la fecha lleva funcionando 18 años con una clientela consolidada.  Como su meta es ampliar su local y colocar un almacén de prendas de vestir, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una maquina recubridora y una cortadora, así mismo invertir en telas, hilos y accesorios.  Nancy de 58 años es una habitante de Barranquilla ejemplo de superación para muchas madres cabezas de familia  y con esta inversión se acercará más a su sueño de prosperidad y así tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
When Nancy was almost an adolescent, at the age of 11, she was sent by her mother to help a woman named Rosa so that she could carry out some tasks, and as this woman had a sewing workshop, she observed how the operators sewed and learned some sewing techniques. She began doing little jobs. Nevertheless, her interest in this art was growing with the passing of time. She sought the support of a state entity and took some courses in order to improve her work, and when she had become an expert, she began her dressmaking workshop that at this time has been functioning for 18 years with an established clientele.

As her goal is to expand her shop and set up a store with articles of clothing, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in an interlock sewing machine and a cutter, as well as investing in fabric, thread, and accessories.

Nancy, who is 58 years old, is a resident of Barranquilla, an example of self-improvement for many mothers who are the heads of families, and with this investment, she will be closer to her dream of prosperity and thus will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in an interlock sewing machine and a cutter, as well as investing in fabrics, thread, and accessories

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angelina, de 65 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, porque sus padres tuvieron bastantes hijos y eran muy pobres y solo la pusieron a trabajar; ahora está casada, su esposo trabaja de jornalero, juntos tienen nueve hijos, de los cuales solo seis están vivos y los otros tres se murieron en la guerra.

Angelina, desde que tenía sus hijos pequeños inicio a vender tortillas, porque su esposo gana poco como jornalero y su madre la animo a iniciar con el negocio, de esa manera a cubierto todos los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja de lunes a sábado.

Angelina, necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos, para obtener otros ingresos económicos. 

El sueño de Angelina, es mejorar sus ventas de tortillas y ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Angelina, who is 65 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school, because her parents had quite a few children and were very poor, and they only put her to work. Now she is married. Her husband works as a day worker. Together they have nine children, of whom only six are still living and the other three died in the war.

Since the time when she had small children, Angelina began to sell tortillas, because her husband earned little as a day worker, and her mother encouraged her to begin the business. In this way she has covered all the household expenses. She works from Monday to Saturday.

Angelina needs the loan to buy pigs in order to obtain other economic income.

Angelina's dream is to improve her sales of tortillas and see her grandchildren grow up.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат, 32 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем математики в средней школе. Также с 2009 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 25 овец, также есть земельный надел размером 1,33 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль. Махабат известна, как допропорядочный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She has higher education. She works as a mathematics teacher in a secondary school. For supplementary income, she has also been farming since 2009. Her farm has three cows and 25 sheep. There is also a land plot of 1.33 hectares, on which she cultivates beans. Mahabat is known as an respectable, honest and fair person. 

In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a cow, as well as mineral fertilisers for soil cultivation. She plants to use the funds from the loan to develop her farm, and build barns for livestock.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her herd and to purchase fertilizers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Domingo Alcides

texts.es:
Domingo Alcides, encontró una bueno oportunidad para ganar dinero en las ventas de comidas, por eso desde hace 8 años decidió incursionar en este negocio, que poco a poco ha ido aumentando sus ingresos y es gracias a esto que ha podido ofrecerle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Cabe destacar, que ha sido la primera experiencia como comerciante para él, por esto se siente muy orgulloso de sí mismo. 
Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, carnes, aceite, verduras, frutas  gaseosas, esto le será de ayuda porque podrá contar con todos los ingredientes para preparar los alimentos que vende y ofrecerle variedad a su clientes. Domingo es un hombre soñador y perseverante, por ello planea ahorrar para poner una distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Domingo Alcides found a good opportunity to earn money in food sales.  Therefore, eight years ago he decided to get into this business, which, little by little, has been increasing his income.  It is thanks to this that he has been able to offer his family a better quality of life.  It should be noted that this has been his first experience as a business man, so he feels very proud of himself.

Nevertheless, he is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, meat, oil, vegetables, fruit, and soft drinks.  This will help him because he will be able to have all the ingredients to prepare the foods that he sells, and to offer quality to his customers.  Domingo is a dreamer and a persevering man, so he plans to save up to be able set up a soft drink distribution.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, vegetables, fruits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sindy Nathali

texts.es: Sindy tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Sindy se dedica a la venta de bisutería collares, pulseras, aretes, etc., los cual elabora ella misma, también tiene venta de frutas en su lugar de habitación, el negocio lo tiene desde hace tres años y medio aproximadamente y además hace poco tiempo elabora chocobananos los cuales los vende con los vecinos, son  su principal fuente de ingresos, por lo que anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual fue utilizado para invertir en productos de bisutería y verduras para mantener a flote su negocio, con la ilusión de mejorar cada vez su producción ella solicita este nuevo crédito a FUSAI dado que desea  invertir en su negocio en la compra de una mayor  mercadería como: piedras, nailon, tenazas, guineos, chocolate derretido, palillos para chocobanano, papas, tomates, etc., para el negocio de bisutería y además, desea invertir en el negocio de frutas y venta de chocobananos y más productos helados de tal forma que pueda mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y poder así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sindy is 23 years old and a single mother that lives with her one-year-old son. She is a woman who is characterized as entrepreneurial, responsible and hardworking. 

Sindy makes a living selling jewelry – necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc. – which she makes herself. She also sells fruit from her home. 

She has had the business for approximately three and a half years, and not long ago she began to make chocolate bananas that she sells to her neighbors. It is her main source of income because previously she obtained a loan, which she used to invest in jewelry products and vegetables that helped keep her business afloat. 

With the hope of improving her production, she is asking for a new loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as stones, nylon, pliers, bananas, melting chocolate, sticks for chocolate bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. for her jewelry business and fruit and chocolate banana business. She also wants to invest in more ice cream/frozen products to improve her sales and therefore be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stones, 	nylon, pliers, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, melted chocolate and sticks for chocolate bananas.

loans.name: Yessenia Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Damas Positivas.
En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2  años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Yessenia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganarse algo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y crianza de sus hijos, para esto ella dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos para el hogar, ella en su casa tiene un taller en el cual elabora almohadas, cojines con diversidad de bordados, arreglos para baños, sala  y cocina, todos hechos en tela o lana, ella elabora estas obras por encargos de sus clientes, también en temporadas navideñas elabora objetos o diseños de este tipo lo cual le deja muy buenas ganancias. Ella antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y otros productos pero dejo eso porque no quería salir de casa y este trabajo le permite ganarse la vida y estar en casa con sus pequeños. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar hilos, telas, lana y otros materiales para sus obras. Lleva más de 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ofrecen los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the Damas Positivas [Positive Ladies] Community Bank meets every two weeks. 

Thirty-one year old Yessenia lives in this place. She is married and has three children from this relationship who are 2, 8 and 10 years old. The older two go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Yessenia is a very hardworking woman who likes to make an effort to earn money in order to help her husband with the household expenses and raising their children. For this reason she makes and sells home decorations. She has a workshop in her home where she makes pillows, cushions with different embroidery patterns, and decor for the bathroom, living room and kitchen, all made from cloth or wool. She makes these pieces to order for her clients. During the Christmas season she makes objects or designs which earn her good profits.

She used to sell clothing and other products but stopped because she didn't want to leave the house. This work allows her to earn a living and be at home with her little ones. She has been doing this work for three years and it is going well.

She will use this loan to purchase thread, fabric, wool and other materials for her work. She has been in the community bank for eight years and likes it because of the support that the loans offer. Her dream is to give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabric, wool and other materials.

loans.name: Tabata Shule Group

texts.en:
Afsa is 20 years old, married and has got one child who is still young. For ten months, Afsa has been supporting her family by running a food stall(mamalishe). She starts working from 06 am to 08 pm per working day and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan to be apportioned among Tabata Shule's five member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will invest part of this loan to buy food cooking ingredients: one sack of rice (50kg), cooking oil, beans, and kilos of meat. In the coming years, Afsa would like to improve her business into a classic restaurant. 

She will be so thankful to everyone who supports her group.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients: one sack of rice (50kg),cooking oil, beans, and kilos of meat

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 31-year-old man, Palestinian refugee, and married father of two children. He lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp. Ten years ago, he started working in air conditioning services and maintenance inside the camp, but he suffered from limited income due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinian refugees, especially those who live in camps.

Today, he is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop his business through buying used air conditioners and selling them at low prices inside the camp. 

Khalil is struggling to increase his income to provide his beloved children a better social and financial life.

loans.use: to buy used air conditioners for resale

loans.name: María Isidra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Damas Positivas.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es médico veterinario. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la ciudad.
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida a base de su trabajo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda- bazar y un taller de costura, ella confecciona todo tipo de ropa para damas y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también lo que confecciona vende en su bazar, en su bazar vende perfumes, zapatos, cosas para regalos y muchos otros artículos. Ella cada vez que recibe los créditos va aumentando la variedad de productos ya que así gana más clientes, lleva más de 28 años realizando esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta en beneficio de su familia.  
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar hilos, otros materiales para la costura, perfumes y productos de bazar. Esta desde el inicio el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Damas Positivas credit group meet every 15 days.

In this place lives María.  She is 58 years old, and she is in a common law marriage, from which she has three grown, independent children.  Her husband is a veterinary doctor.

María is a woman who has always liked to earn her living through her work.  She has a small general store and a sewing workshop.  She make all types of clothes for ladies and children.  She works based on orders from certain people, and she also sells what she makes in her store.  In her store, she sells perfumes, shoes, gift items, and many other items.  Each time she receives a loan, she increases the variety of products, since that way she gains more customers.  She has been working in this business for more than 28 years, which allows her to earn something on her behalf for the benefit of her family.

She will use this new loan to buy thread, other materials for sewing, perfume, and general store items.  She’s been in this credit group since its start, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dreams are to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy thread, other sewing materials, perfumes, and general store items.

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron and his wife, Shpresa or Hope in English are in their early 40s and are parents of three children ranging in ages from 16 to 21. For the past five years, they have been reselling used clothes. The town they live in is known for the highest unemployment rate among other cities. Thus, residents consider buying thrifty things instead, according to Agron. 

Here is what Shpresa said during the visitation from the loan officer: "Prior to starting this activity, we lived in Greece and we performed labour jobs to earn an income. We saved enough money to built a little home for our family. We then, observed the financial situation in our town and of course what other people do to make a living. Gladly, we came up with the idea of selling used-items. We don't make much because if we did, we wouldn't ask for a loan. But we are grateful for making something, because it's better than nothing."

Agron and Shpresa request this loan to buy inventory of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy inventory of used clothing items to resell

loans.name: Delta

texts.en:
Delta is so thankful that she has repeatedly received support for her general store business and faithfully paid her loans which helped meet their daily personal and household needs. The majority of Filipinos do struggle to make ends meet and some have not really reached College so they go into small businesses like a mini store to provide for their family.

Delta has been running her store for eight years already. She sells dry and packaged commodities and mostly essential household and food items. Her store means a lot to her since it is a good source to cover the family's daily sustenance. Although she has difficulty collecting receivables from some of her customers, she maintains a positive attitude that at the end of the day she will earn enough for their daily food.

She trusts that she can again avail a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to fill her store with grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, sodas, and other grocery items. She is praising God and thanking you in advance for your good heart and for the financial assistance that will be granted to her.

Delta dreams to grow her store business. She also wants assist her grandchildren in their educational needs. She prays for good health and protection for her children and their families. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Igembe Nsabo Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her early 30s, is married with two kids. She has been running a clothes shop for one and a half years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
  
This will be Rukia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy clothes for her shop. She dreams of selling clothes that are up to date. 

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group, Igembe Nsabo, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Crespiniano

texts.en: Crespiniano lives in Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is 52 years old and relies on farming rice for a living. He has been a farmer for 12 years now. He is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and gasoline for his motorcycle. Crespiniano is confident that fertilizer will help so he can expect a good harvest in four months. This will assure him of a healthy crop. In the future, he hopes to increase his income and improve his profitability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and gasoline

loans.name: Diega

texts.en: Diega, 46 years old, is from the town of Trinidad in Bohol. She is married with five children. She has been operating a funeral parlor business for six years now. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 in order to buy a car that she can use to deliver coffins. The additional capital will enable her to better operate her business. In the future, she hopes to see her children graduate from college and have a better life. She also plans to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 65 years old, but even at her age, she is not showing a sign of slowing down in doing business. She is engaged in multiple businesses in Trinidad, Bohol. She buys and sells nipa shingles that are used for roofing, and she sells homemade snacks and vegetables. 

She is asking for a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and vegetables that she can cook and sell. This will allow her to cook pancakes, deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar and more vegetables to sell in her community. 

In the future, she will continue to expand her business and save for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and vegetables

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children. She has a maize store from which she sells maize and generates a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

It has now been four years since she began selling maize, and the business is doing well. She plans to buy more stock of maize and beans to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income and support her family. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Sally hopes to expand her cereals business and become a cereals supplier.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize to sell in hopes this will enable her to get more income and support her family.

loans.name: Sirun

texts.en:
Sirun is from Sipanik village in Ararat region where she lives with her husband and two sons. She has been involved in land cultivation for many years. Sirun has a greenhouse near their home yard, where she cultivates cucumber, peppers and greens. Because the greenhouse is very old, there are some improvements needed to be made so that Sirun will have a chance to continue land cultivation. She has requested this loan to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, to buy a polyethylene cover for it and to purchase a cow for livestock.

This is Sirun's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institution previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Sirun faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Sirun has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Sirun with her loan and help her to sustain her farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, to buy a polyethylene cover for it and to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ketino

texts.en:
Ketino, who is 34 years old and a married woman, is from the village Dzegvi. She has a husband and two children. Ketino works as a sales lady at the local store and gets 400 GEL approximately. Her husband has a private activity of being an artisan and gets orders that aren't stable. He has a great desire to get a stable source of income. 

Ketino sought credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables people to get a loan for starting or restarting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 5,000 GEL for purchasing a car her husband will use for a taxi business. He will serve local people, and the family will get a stable source of income, which will enable them to tackle their financial difficulties.
  
This credit will be a great support for the family. Ketino is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her and her husband a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and get income from a taxi business

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.en: Sinforosa, 66 years old, is from Trinidad, Bohol. She owns a piggery and has been raising hogs for two years now. She also farms rice and sells coconut wine. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, feed for her hogs and tannin powder for her coconut wine. The tannin powder is responsible for giving the coconut wine its reddish color. Sinforosa hope to continue managing her businesses well so she can support her own needs and pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer and tannin powder

loans.name: Nkumba Primary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Josephine. She is the head teacher of Nkumba Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 1550 students. Nkumba School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nkumba School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Josephine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a 44-year-old rice farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Amada is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 10 years now; this business entails a lot of hard work. This is the source of their income so she and her husband work hard for the family. 

Amada is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to grow healthy rice, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Amada dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has had a farming business for 30 years now. All her children are adults and she works hard so that she will not be dependent on them for her needs. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. 

Teodula hopes to improve her farm for a better return of investment. She also dreams of expanding the land so that she can cultivate in the future for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 46 years old and a mother of six dependents children ages 8-18. Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming for four years now. This has been their source of livelihood. Like most mothers, she wanted her children to have a life quite different from hers. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan for fertilizer, seedlings, and to pay for labor of the hired help. The extra income that she can get from this will be use for her family’s daily sustenance and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and to pay for labor of the hired help

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is into farming to support her family. She and her family live in San Miguel, a town in Bohol. She and her husband help each other in tilling the land hoping for a good harvest. She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be use to acquire fertilizer, seedlings, and to pay for labor of the people who will help in the land cultivation. 

They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming supplies. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and future business investment. Part of the income will also pay for the school fees of her four children ages 3-15.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Déblompe

texts.fr: Deblompe est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans avec quatre enfants à charge. Habitant à Baguida, Deblompe est une revendeuse de détergents et savons s’approvisionnant et revendant au marché. Deblompe demande ce crédit pour commander du savon et des détergents en vue d’en tirer profit et pouvoir bien développer et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Deblompe is 37 years old and married. She has four dependent children and lives in Baguida. 

She buys detergent and soaps and sells her goods at the market. Deblompe is asking for this loan to buy soap and detergent. 

She would like to earn a profit and further secure her children’s education.

loans.use: buy four boxes of soap and five bags of detergent.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Meline

texts.en:
Meline is a farmer and the proud mother of a son. She and her husband have been involved in cattle raising and land cultivation for five years already.

The farm currently includes 20 sheep and hens, and also is rich with harvests of emmer wheat, potato, cabbage, walnut, pear, and apple. Meline's requested loan will help them to purchase two cows and forage for feeding the livestock, so the farm will provide more income for living.

This is Meline's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Meline faced some difficulties with her health. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments.

Therefore Meline has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Meline's loan to be funded as she is very enthusiastic to enrich her farm and make it big and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice and Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old, married, and has four children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory like candies, cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc,. to sell.

Maria has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling tobacco.

Maria aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like candies, cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently in school.

Crispy is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Crispy requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crispy has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Crispy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old, married, and has six children. Two of her children are still in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Delia requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Virginia has been in this business for 7 years. Virginia earns additional income from food vending and running a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Malgrekatonewende Group

texts.fr:
Mr YACOUBA est responsable du groupe MALGREKATONEWENDE. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02 vont à l'école. Il a 03 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 05 sacs d’engrais et 06 boites d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour bien construire sa cour. Mr ambitionne pouvoir scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. YACOUBA is in charge of the MALGREKATONEWENDE group. He is married and the father of two children who are 6 and 12 years old. Both children go to school and he has three total dependents. 

Mr. Yacouba has been doing market gardening for five years. He buys his supplies in his village. He would like to buy five bags of fertilizer and six boxes of herbicide. 

He would like to use his profits to build a yard for his home. He would like to continue to educate his children.

loans.use: buy five bags of fertilizer and six boxes of herbicide.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Darakert village of the Ararat region where she lives with her husband, mother, brothers-in-law, and two infant kids. Gayane's family is occupied with agriculture. They cultivate different crops and vegetables (mainly cabbage) and sell them in local markets. Gayane's husband, using his own truck, besides their own harvest also sells the harvests of his co-villagers, who give him additional money from sales.

This hardworking family now needs to make some investment in their farm. Gayane asks for this loan to purchase supplies for renovation of the greenhouse and renovation of the car to transport the harvests to the market to sell.

As this is Gayane's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Gayane get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Gayane and her husband hope to receive lenders' support and build the farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for renovation of the greenhouse and renovation of the car to transport the harvest to the market to sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chemicals and fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Four of her children are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Valerie has a buy and sell lumber business in the Philippines. Valerie requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more lumber to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Valerie has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Valerie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gogi

texts.en:
Gogi, 35 years old, is from the village of Etseri in the Terjola district. He lives with his mother, whose pension is the only income for the family. They live under poverty and require a source of income to satisfy even the basic needs. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Gogi applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Gogi plans to purchase beds for his house and start renting it at a good price.

The loan will greatly assist Gogi and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase beds and start renting the house

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is a farmer from the Lori region. She lives with her husband and 26-year-old son who are the main support for Karina's farming work. The family keeps livestock (cows, calves, pigs, hens and bees) and also cultivates wheat, potatoes and some grass. Karina uses the gathered milk in the production of different dairy products and her husband sells them in the market.

The loan requested is important so that Karina and her family can purchase a calf and cow for enlarging the livestock.

This is Karina's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institution previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Karina faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her family members were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Karina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Karina with her loan and help her to sustain her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and cow

loans.name: Urugero Sub Group

texts.en:
URUGERO is a group led by Jean Bosco who is 42 years old. The group's name means “Example” in English. 

Jean Bosco is married and has two children ages 12 and 17.  He owns a shop and has been doing business for the past 5 years. 

The group members sell different items and they all aspire to improving their life. With the loan, Jean would like to buy more sugar, soaps, salt, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and for savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soaps, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Akwaadu Group

texts.en:
This group's members are part of Akwaadu and are beginning its 8th loan cycle with ID-Ghana as part of the loan system in Teshie branch. It is made up of six members and represented by Gladys. The businesses that the members of the group carry out are varied. Among them: smoked fish, cosmetics, maize, cassava dough, cutlery sets, cutting boards, cooking oil, ice chests, and ceramic plates. The loan that they will take out will benefit each small-business entrepreneur in the group of which Gladys is a member. She indicates that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago, joining through the invitation from an officer of the institution. 

Currently, she has a business selling smoked fish and cosmetics from door to door in another town. She makes it known that she learned this business on her own. The loan that she will now take out is for the increase in capital to purchase more smoked fish and cosmetics which she will sell to her customers. She will acquire these products from the wholesalers in the city of Accra. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has children. 

When she is consulted about what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the area of health and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish and cosmetics which she will sell to her customers

loans.name: Namulanda Technical School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Milly. She is the Head Teacher of Namulanda Technical School, a mixed school with 105 students in the urban area of Kajjansi in Wakiso. Namulanda School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Namulanda School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Milly ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Kazo Secondary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Abasi. He is the Head Teacher of Kazo Secondary School, a mixed school with 250 students in the urban area of Kawempe in Kampala.

Kazo School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kazo School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Abasi ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Tchotcho est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans demeurant à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Tchotcho est une commerçante de produits alimentaires qui achète au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Ayant la volonté d’étendre son commerce et de promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants, Tchotcho souhaite ce prêt pour commander de l’huile, du riz et des détergents afin d’atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Tchotcho is married, 42 years old, and lives in Baguida. She has four children. 

She buys groceries at the market and sells them in a boutique in her home. 

She wants to grow her business and promote her children’s education, so she will use her loan to order oil, rice, and detergent. This will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: buy five cans of oil, nine bags of rice, and five bags of detergent.

loans.name: Pengdwende Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA est responsable du groupe PENGDWENDE. Marié, il est père de 11 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 06 vont à l'école. Il a 20 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 12ans. Il s'approvisionne dans son village.
Mr veut s'acheter 03 sacs d’engrais.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne pouvoir scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. MOUSSA is in charge of the PENGDWENDE group. He is married and has 11 children between the ages of three and 24. Six of his children go to school. He has 20 total dependents.

Mr. Moussa has been doing market gardening for 12 years. He buys his supplies in the village. He wants to buy three bags of fertilizer.

He wants to use his profits to strengthen his business. He would like to educate his children.

loans.use: buy three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 64 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He supports another two adults. He has borrowed a loan to purchase energy saving cooking stoves to sell to the community and hopes this will help him generate income.  His hopes and dreams in future is to educate his children and help the community to have the energy saving cooking stoves which will save them time and energy.

loans.use: to purchase energy saving cooking stoves

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has 3 kids. He lives at his own house and he is a mason. He also makes cheese to earn some money and he is assisted by his wife. He and his wife learned to make cheese when they were kids.

Daniel needs a loan to buy a milking cow for his cheese business. He hopes you can help him because he needs to increase his milk production to sell more cheese. Many people have told him that his product is delicious so now he would like to make more cheese. 

In the picture, Daniel is with a machine that he uses in his work.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Perizat

texts.ru: Перизат, 26 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Перизат высшее экономическое образование. У нее только положительные отзывы и репутация. С 1995 года Перизат начала заниматься животноводческой деятельностью, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), Перизат сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме до 25,000 сом (KGS). В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеются: корова, 0,30 Га земли, где выращивает перец для реализации. В целях расширения своего хозяйства Перизат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 11,000 сом (KGS), на полученные денежные средства она намерена купить  удобрения для полеводства и выращивания экологически чистых овощей. Перизат планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и хочет сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Perizat is 26 years old, married and has two children. Perizat has higher education in finance. She has only positive reviews and a good reputation. In 1995, Perizat started working with livestock breeding. From a starting sum of 20,000 som (KGS), Perizat was able to expand her business to get a monthly income of 25,000 som (KGS). Her household currently has a cos and 0.30 hectares of land, where she grows peppers for selling. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Perizat turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 11,000 som (KGS). She intends to use the amount received to purchase fertilizers for cultivating the land and grow ecological vegetables. Perizat plans to invest the income from the business in further improving her household and she would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to cultivate the land and grow organic pepper

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rose who is 47 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014. She underwent training on enterprise development and financial management.

Her main economic activity is green grocery. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more kale, cabbages, crates of tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to increase sales and raise her income, which will improve her living standards and enable her to provide a better diet for her family. 

Rose is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Kpanmanga Kunkuna Group

texts.en:
Maria is a 40-year-old mother of 7 children living in Kunkuna, Bimbilla in the northern region of Ghana. She is a member of a Rice processing group named 'Kpanmanga-Kunkuna', Bimbilla. Maria is the woman squatting at the middle with the hand on a basin of paddy rice in the photo. With about 10 years experience in rice processing, Maria has 4 people understudying her and awaiting graduation. 

She dreams of becoming a permanent employer in the industry in her community and wants to grow her business. There is a ready market for her products, an opportunity Maria wants to utilize to achieve her dream. Maria and her group have therefore applied for a loan of 20,300 GHS. Her share of the loan is 700 GHS, which she will use to buy paddy rice from rice farmers to meet the demand of the home market. 

Maria wants to earn more income to pay back this loan and leave some to cater for her children’s basic needs. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from rice farmers to meet the demand of the home market

loans.name: Kamufa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Oliver; a member of Kamufa Self Help Group. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development. 

He practices mixed farming; indigenous poultry farming, and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy chicken feed and chickens, in order to increase his poultry production. This will increase his income and enable him to pay school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and chicken feed

loans.name: Duhozanye Group

texts.en:
Clementine is a group leader, aged 45. She is married with 6 children aged between 9 and 21. 

Her group is called Duhozanye, which means “Help each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. 

Clementine sells sorghum and has been doing this business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to make savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Kusyaaniwa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Mary is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is twenty nine years old, married, and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

Mary operates a second hand clothes selling business. She is borrowing money to buy more jackets and pullovers for sale during this cold season, hence earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy jackets and pullovers for sale during cold season and earn more income to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Agnes. She is thirty seven years old, married, and has three school going children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. Through the trainings she's undergone, she was able to gain skills in enterprise and financial management. 

Agnes runs a business where she gets a daily income to meet the rising family needs. She is borrowing a loan to add inventory for her shop. By doing so, her daily income will increase, thus she will be in a position to provide her children education, food, shelter, and clothing. 

She is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Betty, a single mother of one aged twenty eight.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to be trained on enterprise development and financial management. These trainings have played a key role in her day to day business activity of maize and beans farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy farm inputs and fertilizers to improve her crop yield. 
This will enable her to get more income, and thus be able to meet her child's needs such as education, clothing, and food. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Farafina R6 Group

texts.fr: Mariam, est âgée de 65 ans mariée mère d’un enfant.Vendeuse depuis des années, elle a débuté son commerce au Sénégal. Son expérience, son respect de sa clientèle, la bonne qualité de sa marchandise et le bon prix qu’elle donne sont pour elle un atout qui fait marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 20  complets de pagne, (15)complet de marque fun; et le divers (bijoux) à 50 000 F . L’utilité du prêt c’est pour s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour revendre afin d’acquérir un bénéfice pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille puisque son époux est à retrait. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 18 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Mariam is 65 years old and has one child. A saleswoman for many years, she started her business in Senegal. 

Her experience, her respect for her clients, the quality of her merchandise, and the good prices she offers are all pluses for her business.

She would like a loan to buy 20 pagne (traditional wraparound) outfits, 15 “fun” brand outfits, and jewelry for 50,000 F.

She will use this loan to buy enough merchandise to earn an income that meets the needs of her family (her husband is retired). She has already had 18 loans and has repaid them all on schedule.

loans.use: buy 20 pagne (traditional wraparound) outfits, 15 “fun” brand outfits, and jewelry for 50,000 F.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is married and has 4 kids. He is living at his parents' house.

Leonardo works as a seamstress and his wife helps him too. He needs a loan to buy a sewing machine for him and his wife, and he really hopes you can help him. Leonardo learned about this business when he was a kid.

He would like to have his own house and to give his children a good education. 

In the picture, he is with some of the clothes that he makes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 30 years old and is a mechanic, and he has been working for 5 years. He is married and has two kids - the oldest is 4 years old and the second is one year old.

Reynaldo works from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. He needs a loan to buy tools for his workshop. Reynaldo's wife works as a cook but her salary is not good, and that is why he hopes you can help him. 

He would like to have his own house in the future, but for now he is paying rent.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Tuzamurane is a group led by Rose, who is 49 years old. The group name means “support each other” in English. 

Rose is married with 8 children aged 2 - 20. She sells sorghum and has been doing this business for the past 29 years. The other group members sell different items but they all have the same idea about trying to change their lives. 

With the loan, Rose would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Avazjon

texts.ru: Его зовут Авазчон. Ему 36 лет. Авазчон мужчина, который всегда думает о своей семье. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Авазчон работает рабочим строителем. Он вместе со своей бригадой строят и ремонтируют дома. Из-за того что эта работа является сезонной и в холодный период года он остается без дела и заработка, Авазчон принял решение параллельно заниматься другой работой. Найти работу в его краях нелегко. Авазчон не найдя работу не сдается и начинает свой бизнес. Он займется животноводством. Поначалу он не будет иметь большого дохода, но постепенно с повышением опыта увеличится и доход. Он просит ему помочь купить несколько голов скотин и начать бизнес.
texts.en: This man is called Avazjon. He is 36 years old. Avazjon is a man who always thinks about his family. He is married and has three children. Avazjon works as a construction laborer. He and his team built and renovate houses. Because this work is seasonal and during the cold time of the year he is without work, Avazjon has taken the decision to engage in other work in parallel. It is not easy to find work in his parts. Not having found a job, Avazjon is not giving up and is starting his own business. He rears animals. To begin with he will not have much income, but gradually with as his experience grows so too will his income. He is requesting help to buy a few heads of livestock and begin his business.

loans.use: to start a new business in the field of animal rearing.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид 41 летний уроженец маленького района Хамадони. Он примерный семьянин и отец трехлетней дочки. Абдурашид ответственный мужчина и он должен обеспечить своих родителей, жену и дочку. Абдурашид занимается выращиванием скотин. У него есть все условия для данного бизнеса, в том числе и опыт. Абдурашид хочет расширить бизнес. Он собирается увеличить поголовья скотин и поэтому просит кредит. Благодаря кредиту он увеличить количество скот и доходность от бизнеса. Тогда его семье откроются новые экономические возможности.
texts.en:
Abdurashid is a 41-year-old native of the small region of Hamadoni. He is an exemplary family-man and the father of a 3-year-old daughter. Abdurashid is a responsible man, and he must provide for his parents, wife, and daughter. He raises livestock for a living. He has everything necessary for the business, including experience. 

Abdurashid wants to expand the business. He intends to increase his livestock headcount, and therefore is requesting a loan. Thanks to the loan, he will increase his number of livestock and the profitability of his business. New economic possibilities will begin for Abdurashid's family.

loans.use: to increase his headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Ma`mura

texts.ru: Маъмура очень добрая женщина, живет в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 55 лет, замужем и она замечательная мать для своих детей. Маъмура всегда заботится о своей семье, родных и близких. Её муж и сын находятся на заработках в России. Маъмура работает дома. Она занимается животноводством. Не каждая женщина сможет справиться одна с этой работой. Она с утра до вечера трудится, чтобы улучшить жизненные условия своей семьи. Маъмура обеспечивает семью молочными продуктами. Однако в данный момент она в трудном положении, так как в России кризис и она не получает денег от мужа. Маъмура решила сама выбраться из трудной ситуации. Она хочет, получит кредит, и увеличить поголовье скота. Таким образом, она сможет расширить свой бизнес и улучшит доход. Этот займ очень важен для Маъмуры. Пожалуйста, помогите ей.
texts.en:
Ma'mura is a very kind woman who lives in J. Rumi district. She is 55 years old, married, and a wonderful mother to her children. Ma'mura always cares for her family, relatives, and close friends. Her husband and son live and work in Russia. 

Ma'mura works at home. She is engaged in animal husbandry. Not ever woman is able to cope alone with this work. She toils from morning to evening, in order to improve the living conditions of her family. Ma'mura provides her family with milk products. 

However, currently she is having difficulties. Due to the crisis in Russia, she does not receive money from her husband. Ma'mura decided to get out of the difficult situation herself. She wants to receive a loan and increase her cattle headcount. In this way, she will be able to expand her business and improve her income. This loan is very important for Ma'mura. Please help her.

loans.use: to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Музафару 40 лет, он из города Куляб. Музафар ответственный и пунктуальный человек. Он женат и отец пятерых детей. Он занимается с женой продажей фруктов и овощей на рынке. Они занимаются этой деятельностью уже много лет. Этим бизнесом  обеспечивают своих детей. Музафар всегда продает свежие фрукты. Для него очень важно, чтобы его клиенты были довольны. Музафар хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого ему нужно купить фруктов и овощей. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. У него есть капитал, но его не хватает для приобретения достаточного количества фруктов и овощей. Он верит в Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Muzafar is 40 years old. He is from the town of Kulob. Muzafar is a responsible and punctual man. He is married and a father of five. With his wife, he sells fruit and vegetables on the market for a living. They have been involved in this business for years. It enables them to provide for their kids. 

Muzafar always sells fresh fruit. It is very important for him to satisfy his customers’ needs. This requires purchasing fruit and vegetables, which is why he requested a loan. He has a certain amount of money laid out, but it is insufficient to buy enough fruits and vegetables. He trusts in you to help him.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables to expand his business

loans.name: Miwani Original Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Penninah. She is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children.  One of her children is in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development. 

She practices poultry farming. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy more chickens to increase her poultry production.  This will increase her income to cover her family's food, clothing, and quality health care services expenses. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
Jackline is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is thirty two years old, married, and a mother of four. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management. 

Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She needs a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her to increase her harvest and increase her income. She will then be in a position to improve her family’s living conditions including quality health care. 

Jackline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is the name of the lady in the photo, a member of Ngeleno Women's Group.  Catherine is thirty years old, married, and a mother of three.

Her economic activity is poultry keeping. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013 and has received trainings on enterprise management and financial planning. These trainings have equipped her with skills for effectively running her poultry business. Catherine requires a loan to purchase quality chicken feed and also to buy more chickens. She believes this will increase her income. She will therefore be able to sustain her family's needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase quality chicken feeds and buy more chickens

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a widow and mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. 

She does indigenous poultry keeping business. She is borrowing a loan to pay for renovation expenses for her poultry structure and to buy chicken feed. This will boost poultry production and increase her income, allowing her to pay for food, clothing, and school fees for her children.

Kanini is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and pay for renovation expenses of the poultry structure

loans.name: Dianelys

texts.en:
Dianelys is originally from Cuba and has lived in the United States for the past 15 years. She started her medical supply business about two years ago when she realized that her knowledge of medical supplies was a valuable asset.

Before becoming self-employed, she worked for a major medical supply distributor where she was able to build strong relationships with clients. She knew that her network, knowledge of and experience in the industry were great reasons to open up her own medical supply business.

Dianelys successfully runs her business on her own and is currently looking for a loan to better serve her clients. She would like to invest in a catalog that is unique to her store and would allow her clients to easily access information on and knowledge of all of the products she is able to supply through her business.

loans.use: to pay for business catalog printing and design.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Christine, 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has undergone the training on enterprise development and financial management. She runs a salon and she is borrowing from Kiva to add to her savings and buy a dryer to improve her income, which will enable her to serve more customers, improve her living standards, take her children to a better school and pay their school fees without difficulties.

Christine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer for her salon business for better income and to be able to pay schools fees for her children.

loans.name: Jori

texts.ru: 62 летный мужчина Чори. Он отец четверых детей. Дети взрослые семейные. Им 32, 28, 24 и 20 лет. Чори сильный и авторитетный дехканин. Он 20 лет своей жизни продвигает на земле. Чори занимается  растениеводством. Он трудится на земли и зарабатывает на жизнь. Растениеводство является единственным источником дохода. Чори тоже хорошо воспитывал  своих детей, они сейчас тоже занимаются земледелием и животноводством. В селах и районах Республики люди трудятся на земле и выращивают животных. И у каждого из них есть свой источник доход. Чори нуждается в кредит для купли минеральных удобрений. Для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ему не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по этой причине Чори обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: This 62 year old man is Jori. He is the father of four children. His children are grown up and married. They are 32, 28, 24 and 20 years old. Jori is a strong and authoritative farmer. He has spent 20 years of his life farming. Jori grows crops. He works the ground and earns a living. Growing crops is his only source of income. Jori has taught his sons well, and now they also grow crops and rear animals. In the villages and regions of the Republic, people work the earth and rear animals. Each of them has their own source of income. Jori needs a loan to buy mineral fertilizer. He lacks part of the money he needs in order to buy a sufficient quantity of fertilizer, and for this reason Jori has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and treat his land with it.
